Job Description: The Role: S&P Global Platts’ Commercial Graduate Program has an approximate duration of 18 months starting in March & September 2019. It begins with an intensive training schedule for the first 6 months focusing on building a foundational knowledge of the commodity markets, developing soft and problem solving skills while learning about various Platts’ data, research and analytical products. Combined with on the job learning experience, participants must complete and pass certification milestones along with a rigorous evaluation process that will test and stretch their skills and capabilities.   The Location: Singapore The Team/The Business:  You will be part of a rapidly growing organization with an exceptional corporate culture. Our data, analytics, and research help our customers make informed, smarter business decisions and investments. We are looking for high achievers from a diverse pool of undergraduates that are passionate about the commodities market and want to develop their career in a dynamic, high performing and multicultural commercial team. You will be someone who can quickly work out how to make things happen through, intellectual curiosity, creativity, exceptional learning agility and problem solving skills as well as effective networking and collaboration skills.  The Impact:  Initially starting as a Client Services Representative, you would be a primary contact for clients, providing solutions to their requests in a timely, professional and courteous manner and provide training on Platts’ products through WebEx and onsite visits. As you progress though the programme, you will have the opportunity to support the sales team and ultimately generate additional revenue that helps to grow our business. What’s in it for you:  You will be offered the opportunity to assist S&P Global Platts in achieving its mission of being one of the leading providers of the highest quality price assessments and analytical information to the world’s financial and commodity markets. Our real-time news, pricing and analytical services help markets operate with transparency and efficiency worldwide.  As the principal provider of commodity price assessment and information to more than 10,000 customers in 150 countries and with 20 offices spanning five continents, you will form part of a truly globally diverse workforce. You will get challenged on a daily basis with a steep learning curve. You will get an opportunity to work with a broad range of clients including commodity trading houses, major oil and Gas companies, investment banks, hedge funds and investment managers and get to be part of a large fun and international team with fantastic opportunities for growth. Career paths after the 18-month initial phase of the program include:  Sales Relationship/Account Management Product Specialist
Job Requirements: Responsibilities:   Helping clients to navigate and extract data from the S&P Global Platts product range. Provide assistance with building models using the S&P Global Platts Excel Plug-in. Liaising with the content, commercial and technical teams to address any client queries and ensure our data is maintained to the highest standards. Proactively reaching out to clients for training (this will apply towards the later stages of development once fully fluent and certified on the product range). Logging all client interactions using our CRM tool (Salesforce) for internal analysis. Providing our clients with face to face/WebEx training Getting involved in special project initiatives where determined necessary by management  What we’re looking for:   GPA equivalent of 3.2 or above in a BSc or BA degree, or equivalent. Strong presentation and communication skills. You must have good telephone manners and be comfortable presenting to large groups both in person or remotely. Familiarity with or strong interest in learning about financial markets. Good PC skills including the Microsoft Office product range, Sales Force and Oracle. Ability to effectively multi-task and work independently. Willingness to learn and take on a wide variety of tasks.  About S&P Global Platts: At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets.  Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.platts.com                Interested candidates should visit our career site to submit an application – http://careers.spglobal.com

Job Title: Manager, Products, Loyalty And Events Management
Job Location: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 10 MARINA BOULEVARD 018983
Job Description: The candidate will be responsible for the strategy, roadmap, and feature definition of a product or product line and also work with a team to drive customer engagement and usage through a world-class events and loyalty rewards platform.  Responsibilities also include:  • Conceptualize, plan and execute marketing strategies to deliver product revenue growth, market share growth, product and loyalty platform margin improvements. • Drive new card membership benefits enhancements (including rationalization & retirement) through understanding market dynamics, competitive environment, technological advancements, customer preferences and portfolio analysis. • Stay abreast of market trends and identify event opportunities that generates interest. Plan, design and produce events while overseeing project delivery elements within timelines. • Drive engagement and loyalty through ownership of the loyalty rewards platform including the end-to-end customer journey from points earn to redemption, and providing strategic insights and ideas to improve the program based on data analytics. • Oversee sponsorship requests, events organization and management – includes liaising with agencies, vendors, external partners, merchants venue, planning, on-site support and overseeing full event logistics (e.g. décor, guest list, transport, venue, promotional material etc) to ensure seamless execution of event. • Establish and grow partnerships with key brands, partners, merchants and service providers for acquisitions / marketing partnerships / events developments. • Track and drive improvement to key metrics like product acquisition and usage, loyalty rewards cost, events engagement, customer satisfaction and post-analysis of events / marketing campaigns. • Be responsible for conducting product trainings and ensure product information on various communications channels is always kept updated. • Provide weekly, monthly and annual reporting to the senior management • Implement and manage product processes to ensure compliance to brand requirements and maximum efficiency between teams and internal stakeholders • Marketing, forecasting, and profit and loss (P&L) responsibilities. Manage budget and book keeping - dealing effectively and punctually with any incoming and outgoing expenses and providing associated reports.
Job Requirements: The role requires a creative and strategic thinker with understanding and experience in marketing and events. The successful candidate should have at least 5 years of relevant experience with a proven track record in delivering business results and solid strategy conceptualization to execution experience, with a knowledge of and passion for the premium lifestyle and preferences.  Required skills: • Solid leadership qualities with the ability to work with and communicate clearly with people from all levels. • Possess strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects, campaigns and / or events simultaneously. • Poised, proactive, extremely detail-oriented with a creative streak to bring fresh perspectives to the portfolio. • Assertive and driven individual with persistence and will to succeed. • Strong problem-solving skills – approaches problems with a rational, solution oriented mindset and the ability to exercise logic and good judgment to provide the appropriate outcome. • Ability to resourcefully and calmly handle any issues and troubleshoot any unexpected situations on the event days. • Adaptable, resourceful and can shift priorities quickly in a fast-paced environment. • Versatile as a team player and individual contributor, independent and has strong work ethics and integrity. • Individual should also have a respect for deadlines without compensating on quality of work. • Excellent communication skills – write well, speak eloquently, and are comfortable presenting to senior leadership. • Meticulous attention to details and believe that anything worth doing, is worth doing right – every single time. • Experience in marketing to affluent segments is a big plus. • Willingness to work nights and weekends during key campaign / event periods if needed. American Express has been awarded Aon Hewitt Best Employer Singapore six times. Join us and you’ll soon see why.  As an employee, you can expect challenging work, with purpose. Be more than just your job. Be the voice of inspiration and transform the way the world does business for a living. By joining American Express, you are choosing to become a part of the dynamic team that is recognized as Singapore's "Best Employer 2018". Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.  Why American Express? There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.  American Express has been making a difference in people’s lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.  We’ve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or community. And when they’re ready to take on a new career path, we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best future they envision.  Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.  The powerful backing of American Express. Don’t make a difference without it. Don’t live life without it.

Company Name: JONES LANG LASALLE PROPERTY CONSULTANTS PTE LTD
Job Description: Responsibilities:  Lead the preparation and continued ownership of Regional Portfolio Opportunity Assessment. This includes working with Lease Administration, Occupancy Planning and Transaction Management on the Regional Level to identify portfolio related opportunities for the client. In addition, work at the direction of the Global Portfolio Strategy function to ensure all deliverables tie back to the Global Opportunity Assessment.  Throughout the year, ensure that actions agreed to and defined in the Opportunity Assessment are delivered on time to the client. Regularly update the Opportunity Assessment with changes that occur during the calendar year. Lead the preparation of Metro and Country Plans. This includes data collection, analytics and financial modelling of potential occupancy scenarios at both the strategic and implementation phases of the project timeline. Coordination and delivery, in assistance to the Account/IPS Lead for external and internal reporting processes as it pertains to client’s regional real estate portfolio. Work closely with the JLL APAC Regional Account Lead, JLL Regional Transaction Manager(s), JLL APAC Regional Occupancy Planner and any other Account Staffing to ensure all portfolio processes follow the One JLL Approach. Work with the JLL Global Portfolio Planning Lead on development and implementation of improvements to the portfolio planning process and tools. Develop reporting as necessary to support Quarterly Business Reviews. This role is based on-site at client office a minimum of 2 days per week and at JLL office otherwise. Time spent on-site may increase as required. Benchmarking and ad-hoc projects if and when needed.
Job Requirements: Requirements:  Ability and drive to take initiative and act independently where needed. Understanding of corporate real estate process, business needs and Asian markets. More than 5 years prior experience, preferably within a corporate real estate or service provider environment. Strong financial and analytical abilities. Strong Excel skills. Experienced in developing PowerPoint presentations for senior leadership review.  Clear logic and results orientated portfolio assessments. Comfortable with a matrixed reporting style and working with different time zones globally. Agile work style with the ability to change as business requirements evolve.

Job Title: Assistant Director / Senior Manager (Customer Experience Design)
Job Location: THE JTC SUMMIT, 8 JURONG TOWN HALL ROAD 609434
Job Industry: Public / Civil Service, Real Estate / Property Management
Job Description:
Assistant Director/Senior Manager (Customer Experience Design)
JTC is undergoing a digital transformation journey to revamp our customer-facing website and mobile app services, and we are looking to hire good people who are self-starters, ready to take on an advocate role to drive customer-centric design thinking approaches and implement initiatives across the organisation. He/she must be passionate about creating a positive customer experience across various touchpoints and platforms. You will be required to work closely with various stakeholders across various levels in the organisation. 
 
What you will be doing

Drive strategic UI/CX improvements and initiatives across the organisation. This includes design thinking workshops, focus groups and activities with various stakeholders to evaluate and improve design usability of our different customer touchpoints
Develop journey-based thinking and journey development frameworks
Analyse and evaluate customer initiatives using data analytics
Monitor, review and refine these journeys/initiatives to demonstrate value or satisfaction level improvements
Facilitate co-creation of design solutions with key stakeholders from different line units
Advocate user-centred design process and thinking  

 
What you need to have

Min. 10 years of previous experience leading projects or driving the implementation of customer-fronting digital platforms.
Demonstrated portfolio of being involved in customer experience transformation, service design and data-driven customer experience design 
Strong verbal and written communications as well as interpersonal skills
Visual acuity with an appreciation for good user-system interactions
Comfortable working as both project leader and contributor to a larger team
Relevant qualifications in user experience and/or service design will be advantageous
Job Requirements: None

Job Title: AVP, Financial Literacy and Digital Engagement, Consumer Banking Group (190000JU)
Job Location: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 12 MARINA BOULEVARD 018982
Job Description: Business Function  As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.  Responsibilities   Develop a suite of educational resources and engagement tools to explain the importance of cultivating good financial disciplines, ensuring adequate protection and developing a sound plan to grow wealth through practical investing. This includes content origination in multiple formats such as video, infographics, lifestyle articles and educational pieces, as well as adaptation for use on a plethora of digital platforms.  Distill technical investing and financial facts and concepts into engaging, easy-to-understand and execute on digital communications strategies.  Design a contextual messaging framework and execute accompanying campaigns to re-engage investors and increase trading activity. Work closely with Marketing and Public Relations teams, in the development of key messages and supporting communication materials for campaigns and events.  Cultivate partnerships with external organisations championing financial literacy e.g. tertiary institutions, community groups to develop the syllabus, data and training resources. Provide oversight for the creative and communications components of these partnerships end-to-end.     Support the development of our online platforms and communities that deliver financial literacy and financial planning content, specifically in the areas of user interface design and digital communications centered around the customer journey.  Draw insights from business analytics to measure effectiveness of campaigns and refine upcoming engagement strategies Manage campaign/partnership workflow and administration. Conduct regular marketplace analysis and update the team on innovations and noteworthy developments in the digital financial planning and investment space, such as breakthrough marketing approaches, investor engagement strategies or digitally-assisted advisory.
Job Requirements: Degree in Communications, Marketing, Business or Finance  5 - 8 years of relevant working experience, particularly in finance and/or communications Good knowledge of financial facts and concepts, investment products and services including funds, equities, forex, fixed income.  Strong command of English, exceptional writer/editor, and a good eye for user-interface design Experienced and comfortable working across different media: video, copywriting, infographic creation Strong relational and interpersonal skills, able to partner and work with stakeholders across the organization to deliver results in a fast-paced environment Creative and innovative thinker, a driven self-starter

Job Title: VP, Data Engineer, HACK2HIRE, Technology and Operations
Job Location: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 12 MARINA BOULEVARD 018982
Job Description: Business Function  Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. We’re looking for effervescent proponents of our vision who are driven to understand the impact of technology across varying levels all over the world to be part of a major transformation programme to reimagine banking.  Based in Singapore, you’ll be leveraging the latest technology to develop mission critical applications from scratch. You will be part of the strategic transformation programme which is engaging in UX, design thinking, Agile, cloud technologies, microservices and Big Data. Responsibilities  •Leveraging the latest technology to develop mission critical applications from scratch.  •Design, develop, test and deploy new applications as part of the strategic transformation program •Work on Agile, cloud technologies, microservices and Big Data. •Build and improve machine learning and analytics platform. •Optimize and productionize machine learning models to enable data-driven business activities at large scale.
Job Requirements: •Experience in fields encompassing Distributed computing, Big Data Analytics, Data Transformation •Relevant industry experience in large scale crawling on cloud platforms would be favorably considered •Hands on experience on HDFS (Hadoop), spark, impala, hive •Hands on experience on AWS platforms and at least one SQL database technologies such as Teradata SQL, Exadata SQL, T-SQL •Core Java experience, familiarize with at least one more scripting language •Fundamental knowledge of distributed Architectures, SOA, Micro-services, PaaS •Excellent understanding of software engineering principles and design patterns •Excellent programming skills in either Python, Scala, or Java •In-depth understanding of data science and machine learning technologies and methodologies. •Deep understanding of computer science fundamentals such as algorithm design, complexity analysis •Monitor and address issues relating to capacity constraints and performance related items •Solid knowledge of distributes system concepts, understand the mechanisms of parallel systems such as Hadoop, Spark, Zookeeper etc.  •Familiar with parallel execution models, able to reason / debugging in Spark RDD, Kafka topics •Experienced in performance tuning for at least one of the parallel systems, such as Spark, Hadoop MR, Kafka etc. Desired •A team player who can work well with people •A self-starter who can work independently to meets challenging targets •Great communicator with strong influencing and negotiation skills

Job Description: As an Xtremax digital team member, experience the thrill of working on digital transformation projects for our clients—many of whom hail from government bodies. (Can you hear your portfolio trembling with excitement?)   You will not only have the honour of mapping out our clients' customer journey, but develop concepts and prototypes that will eventually be implemented to produce results and make a business impact, and guide our clients on the exciting path to digital transformation and innovation, too.   Are you ready to deliver digital experiences?    Responsibilities  Analyse and design user experience solutions for our websites based on established design principles and in accordance with design strategy, best practices, and guidelines. Collaborate with team members to generate holistic, thoughtful, and innovative user experience solutions for projects Gather business requirements and translate them into workable and strategic digital solution specifications and prototypes Help our clients leverage social media, analytics, web and mobile technology to strengthen their brand and achieve business objectives Co-facilitate trainings/workshops with clients Engage in meticulous data-driven processes, such as testing and gathering user experience data in accordance with well-researched plans and specifications Be aware of the latest digital trends and UX best practices
Job Requirements: Degree in any discipline Open-minded, and willing to learn Flexible and dynamic team player Comfortable in new environments, and unafraid to speak up Eye for details, with ample knowledge of visual design principles Keen interest in technology, and familiarity with current digital trends Good presentation and listening skills Relevant experience in UI/UX is preferred

Job Description: Responsibilities  Assist in enhancing turnover and profits by increasing student numbers on all programmes Create brand equity through design consistency of all school materials and standardized branding details Compile, consolidate and present market information Interview and record testimonials for marketing purposes from students who have graduated from Insworld Institute, giving assistance with testimonials when needed Prepare the agenda and record and prepare the minutes for all marketing and public relations meetings Plan and execute all web campaigns, SEO/SEM activities, display campaigns, e-commerce, and compile marketing database Build and manage content for web digital platforms, and apply strategy and analytics (measurement experiments) for digital marketing activities Manage web content; be able to edit videos; write code for changes to website; understand and write html and php; upload videos to social media and apps Develop and manage the implementation of digital marketing processes and systems for the Sales and Marketing team in order to ensure outcomes are achieved for the division Perform any other duties as directed Work with vendors on website.
Job Requirements: Requirements   Minimum Diploma in Marketing, Mass Communications or Business Administration with at least 3 years of experience Significant and in-depth marketing communications experience with demonstrable evidence of business partnering activities across multiple stakeholders Ability to plan and mange at both strategic and operational levels Ability to analyze marketing data and research Excellent communication skills Ability to meet deadlines and handle a high volume of work Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, video editing software, Photoshop and Wordpress. Disciplined, highly-driven, capable of showing initiative Demonstrable skills, knowledge and experience in the design and execution of marketing communications and public relations activities Have relevant hands-on experience of digital communication channels including social media  (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Linked-in), websites, social networking sites, mobile devices, apps, etc. Strong interest in the education sector Able to handle communication with students and parents

Job Location: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 12 MARINA BOULEVARD 018982
Job Description: Job Summary: The Business Development Analyst is responsible for supporting the business plans and initiatives of the Regional Business team. This includes tracking and analyzing trends in the Asia Pacific Liquified Natural Gas (LNG), natural gas, power markets and supply chain solutions including shipping and LNG/gas supply chain infrastructure, and being accountable for the business planning and analysis of the Regional Business. Job Responsibilties:  Provide commercial and deal analytics to support business development, solutions and operations teams to evaluate opportunities and pricing decision. Support the preparation of pitches, proposals or/and tender submissions. Support the review of multi-year business plans to achieve strategic vision; including establishing annual budget for sales, expenses and earnings. Responsible for in-depth analysis of targeted markets and support business development managers in understanding market issues and identifying opportunities. Through research and market analyses, understand market issues and assess upcoming trends. Produce periodic reports/presentations and regularly communicate market views to internal and external stakeholders. Maintain and regularly update regional business development pipeline based on business activities, and prepare monthly management reports. Provide analysis of Asia Pacific and targeted regional markets, including supply, demand and prices of natural gas, alternative energy sources and electricity. Evaluate regional energy markets and policies and competitive positioning of alternative energy developments and/or market players/competition, and monitor developments in LNG/gas supply chain solutions.
Job Requirements: The ideal candidate will have a tertiary degree in engineering and/or business discipline. In addition, s/he will:   Be well-versed with research and analytical methodologies and tools. Be able to conduct timely adhoc research to support commercial decision making as well as progress long-term research, develop models, and/or generate reports. Be resourceful, internet savvy, quick to respond and ability to conduct market research and deep dive to obtain needed information, and ask key questions. Have proven ability to gather, synthesize, analyze and disseminate information with excellent presentation slide development skills. Have knowledge of the Oil & Gas/LNG industry, particularly in commercial and/or business analysis and planning with strong business acumen. Have a good knowledge of LNG/natural gas supply chain and solutions, supply & demand outlook. Possess strong and effective organizational, oral and written communication skills. Possess strong analytical skills, numerate, sharp with numbers to support deal evaluation. Possess high level of proficiency in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

Company Name: INTERNATIONAL TABLE TENNIS FEDERATION ASIA-PACIFIC LTD.
Job Description: LOCATION: The position will be based in the ITTF Asia-Pacific offices in Singapore. Applicants should be willing to work as required rather than regular office hours, due to the nature of the work required for the job. REMUNERATION: The ITTF Sponsorship Operations Manager will be paid a remuneration, based on skillset and experience. MANAGER: The ITTF Sponsorship Operations Manager will report to the Head of Sponsorship.  MAIN RESPONSIBILITY: To manage the implementation and relationships with current partners for ITTF events, players and teams, with specific focus on the Asia region including China. Key ITTF events include: World Table Tennis Championships, ITTF World Tour, World Cups, Global Junior Program and Para Table Tennis competitions. DUTIES: Have a key role in coordinating sponsorship rights implementations and operations to support the ITTF Strategic Plan, by working towards achieving the following objectives:  Manage the delivery of sponsors’ rights for events, social media and other sponsorship activation; Ensure the cooperation between all stakeholders including event organisers, sponsors, suppliers, and ITTF staff for a well-coordinated delivery; Establish timelines, guidelines and communication processes for smooth and clear operations; Attend selected events for onsite support, and when off-site, prepare briefing for the onsite-team to manage further implementation at the events; Creation of post event & campaign sponsorship reports; Understand sponsorship as a marketing communication platform; Understand sponsorship reports and analytics to support sponsorship management; Other tasks as required by the Marketing Department.
Job Requirements: Essential Criteria  Relevant tertiary education in Events Management, Sports Management and/or Business; Strong administrative ability and detail-oriented; Excellent communication and analytical capabilities in English;  Proven ability to build rapport with wide range of stakeholders;  Ready to perform a wide range of event-related tasks from on-the-ground operations to back office and administration, under time pressure; Strong organisational skills and a demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects  All applications must be made through the online application form on ITTF.com, and will only be accepted until 28th February 2019.

Job Description: We are looking for a person who has hands on experience in JDA TMS product and has working experience either in Implementation or product/application support role. In this role, the associate is expected to handle multiple projects of various degrees of complexity in an independent manner working with the project teams and other Infrastructure teams in Cloud department. Position involves a role that is responsible for implementation of JDA Transportation Management with good knowledge on JDA Transportation Management / Transportation planner. These include independently handling the implementation and provide solution to technical/functional issues. Associate should have strong product knowledge in at least any 3 of the below areas. Should be ready for short term customer travels during implementation phase of the project. Should be a self-motivated leader in his/her own sense.  Transportation planner / Transportation Manager (TM/TP) Transportation Modeler (TMOD) Logistics Procurement (LP) Business Analytics – Cognos, Informatica. Webservices – SOAP. Oracle RDBMS concepts. ABPP / Java. Windows / Unix OS concepts.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Technical Architect  Should have good knowledge in the JDA Transportation Management. Should have hands on experience with installing and configuring the product and understand the interactions within various modules. Should have implementation experience on JDA Transportation Management with at least one or two full cycle implementation experience. It is preferable if the candidate has previous experience of working in any of the cloud technologies and should be familiar with the basic network terminologies. Should have experience in reviewing the integration design and suggest best practices. Should work as a liaison between Consulting, Support and Cloud Services to ensure smooth and efficient implementation and integration between technical and functional system requirements during on-boarding of new customers or during upgrades or patch updates It is mandatory to have good knowledge of Oracle RBDMS concepts and administration. Knowledge of RAC (Real Application Cluster) is an added advantage. Candidate should be able to review an existing application set up and perform an assessment for suitability to upgrade. Understands how JDA solutions can be configured to better facilitate client business processes. Should have strong analytical skills and problem-solving skills. Knowledge of any defect management tool will be an added advantage. Ensures quantity and quality content in the Knowledgebase. Should be able to drive a KT and Transition plan effectively. It will be an added advantage to have a candidate with knowledge of incident, problem and change management process. Responsible for incident resolution for specific set of customers within the specified POD / Product / Project Adheres to priority based management based on impact + urgency Drive Service Improvement Plans and ensuring the Incident Management process is performed as designed
Job Requirements: Educational Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Masters degree in Computer Applications or other equivalent technical field.   Communication   Associate has good English language Skills both verbal and written Associate has expert customer service/phones skills - Being able to walk associates through advanced tasks over the phone and dealing with difficult customers Must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact with a wide variety of internal and external personnel with emphasis on follow-through and reporting. Must have excellent organization and technical documentation skills.   Personality Fit: Ability to work calmly under pressure and meet deadlines. Ability to make modifications to the systems with little or no interruption of service. Ability to organize projects and tasks according to priorities. A person in this position should be a good project leader and have the ability to communicate effectively project plans and status of projects. Must be self-motivated and enjoy a sense of pride in their accomplishments. Work Experience   Should Have  8– 10 years’ work experience Must have experience on JDA TMS Product. Proficient in Oracle SQL , PL/SQL , Shell scripting (Power shell, Perl), WebLogic, Cognos BI. Product implementation cycle knowledge.   Nice to have  Cloud architecture basic knowledge Nice to have – Proficiency in Windows/Unix commands and troubleshooting skills ABPP custom development experience will be an added advantage. Knowledge of Transportation concepts Implementation experience is an added advantage. Oracle performance tuning experience Proficiency in Windows/Unix commands and troubleshooting skills Basic networking/FTP concepts Knowledge of incident, problem and change management process. Knowledge of Informatica ETL process is an added advantage. Knowledge of load building, rating, load optimization etc. Knowledge of EDI process / EDI mapping will be an advantage. Knowledge in Mulesoft Integration is an added advantage. Knowledge of any DevOps model will be an added advantage. Knowledge of sizing the hardware on private / public clouds will be an added advantage. Knowledge of designing high availability applications will be an added advantage.     Miscellaneous Able to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, as project and system availability requirements demand. Should be ready for short term travel to customer location during implementation phase of the project

Job Description: About the role At DATAVLT, we’re on a mission to make life easier for our users by providing an innovative, on-demand data analytics platform integrated with blockchain to help business owners understand their data, gain insights and make sharper decisions while continuing to focus on developing their business and scaling efficiently. As a Product Designer, you will work in a cross-functional environment to design user-centric products for the DATAVLT platform. In this role, you will discover what are our user needs by conducting research into market gaps, user behaviours and motivations. You will be given autonomy and ownership to inspire change and create new innovative products. Your job as a Product Designer is to help the team to solve complex challenges and craft impressionable experiences that would highlight our products’ functionalities and capabilities.
Job Requirements: Minimum qualifications:  3-5 years of relevant work experience, including experience with UX research and product design. Experience with end-to-end design process from user research, visual design, prototyping to post-release iterations.  Preferred qualifications:  Experience with developing and executing product development strategy and vision. Experience in designing and undertaking significant ownership in a product scope with a high degree of complexity. Experience with planning and executing research such as competitive landscape, requirements gathering, survey design and survey analysis. Possess excellent interpersonal, collaboration and communication skills.  Responsibilities  Develop and define DATAVLT products pipeline from systems design to process design to interface design. Plan and conduct market, technical feasibility, qualitive and quantitative research to validate and evaluate product concepts. Collaborate in the development of user personas, journeys, stories, product frameworks and system design. Establish and define holistic information structure, architecture policies and procedures in relation to product requirements. Design and document product interaction models, content flow, wireframes, user flow. Establish and ensure user-centric design consistency and continuity across DATAVLT products with internal team as well as external vendors. Lead and manage internal product team as well as external partners/vendors. Define and implement test plan for product User Acceptance Testing.

Job Location: THE SIGNATURE, 51 CHANGI BUSINESS PARK CENTRAL 2 486066
Job Description: An exciting opportunity for analytics professionals to work as Data Business Analyst and support the implementation of the Management Information System from a functional perspective.
Job Requirements: Mandatory Skill-set:  ​Bachelor's Degree in IT, Business, Accounting or Finance; At least 3 years of experience in data management and project implementation; Proven ability to interact with business teams and convey analytical results into simplified and actionable reports; Experience in data flows and analytics to support performance and risk calculations; Knowledgeable in MS Excel/ VBA; Ability to manage and communicate with various stakeholders ,external vendors and IT efficiently; Ability to work independently, manage stress and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.  Desired Skill-set:  Experience in SQL/Python.  Responsibilities:  Act as a business analyst to understand the business users' requirements and document it into functional specifications; Suggest recommendations to streamline and improve the current data management, performance measurement/attribution, investment risk concepts, methodology and workflows; Work together with stakeholders, various business group users and external vendors to implement the requirements and resolve any issues raised; Conduct User Acceptance Testing on the requirements; Ensure timely coordination for support and upgrades on MIS performance; Support project administration as necessary.   Should you be interested in this opportunity, please send your updated resume to apply@sciente.com at the earliest. Confidentiality is assured, and only shortlisted candidates will be notified.  EA License: 07C5639

Job Description: Ensure that the businesses provide the “right numbers, on time, with no surprises” to both Group and to the Regional office.  Ensure quality business partnering for the APAC Leadership Team, based in Singapore and to be a key link between the Group and APAC teams. Use knowledge of systems, project management and influencing skills to make a step change in analytics for the region.
Job Requirements: ILLUSTRATIVE DIMENSIONS  Develop a strong working relationship with the various stakeholders across functions and regions Ensure that the Region has a detailed and in-depth understanding of the financial results and drivers to the business, and that this is clearly communicated to Group Develop all aspects of financial planning, reporting and management of information of the business Contribute to reporting to the Region and Group on the APAC results in accordance with reporting timetable Collaborate and contribute in global, regional and local finance projects Manage a team of 4 Finance Analysts (2 senior) within the regional finance team, based in Singapore Support of Head of Finance and wider APAC Leadership Team  KEY TASKS INCLUDE: Financial Planning & Analysis  Lead the accurate and prompt reporting of the APAC regional budget and forecast processes Lead the accurate monthly and year end APAC regional reporting (KPIs) process for group Support the creation of the APAC region 5 year plan for inclusion in the group plan Understand and constructively challenge financials, budgets, forecasts and KPIs within APAC Drive improvement of analytics capability and insight, particularly in new routes to market and sales channels Work closely with Group Finance (UK) and APAC market finance teams  Business partnering / commercial finance support  Support of new business assessment (e.g. product launch, pricing, distribution modelling) Support of strategic projects (e.g. route to market assessments, change management projects and other ad hoc projects collaborating with cross functions and local market leaders) Support of regional allocations and supply, closely linked with the global team Leadership on regional pricing, maintenance of price database and regional price administration Provide insight to the financials, foresee upcoming risks and opportunities Develop presentations from conceptual information to completion  Leadership   Manage a team of 4 Senior and Junior analysts Line manager with the responsibility to coach, develop & appraise  Accounting & controlling  Close liaison with finance shared-service centre colleagues in Singapore Close understanding of the Group consolidation process and impact on the region Ensure adherence with relevant group reporting requirements Ensure adherence with standard operating procedures

Job Description: Senior Business Analyst Job Description: A subsidiary of mainboard listed Singapore Press Holdings (SPH), StreetSine Technology/Singapore Real Estate Exchange (SRX) is a digital analytics company specializing in Singapore and Hong Kong real estate. Its data offerings, market intelligence tools and consultancy are well recognized and widely used by the real estate industry and government organizations. We are currently looking for a Senior Business Analyst to be part of our Business Intelligence (B.I.) team. The candidate will be exposed to a variety of high-profile projects and be rewarded with attractive renumeration. Reporting to the Chief Data Officer (CDO), you will work closely with internal teams to:  Perform market research, product analysis and benchmarking studies for the company; Analyse business opportunities and produce clear reports/presentations to facilitate decision making; Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders in establishing business requirements for key projects, including strategic value propositions and product enhancements.  Expected Competencies: A fast, adaptive yet meticulous professional having the following qualities: 1. Independent Team Player with Strong Communication Skills The candidate must be a mature team player with a high level of integrity, initiative and is able to work under pressure and deliver quality work within a stipulated timeline. Good interpersonal and communication skills are essential. 2. Business Acumen and Analytical Skills The candidate must have demonstrated ability to identify and build business value propositions with both internal and external stakeholders, analytical skills and creative thinking. 3. Technical Competency The candidate must be able to perform financial modelling and data visualization in order to translate complex datasets into strategic business insights.
Job Requirements: Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree or above in real estate or a business-related discipline. Ability to work autonomously on self-directed projects or in tandem with a team. Proficient in Microsoft Office application and/or other financial/analytical modelling tools. Candidates with proficiency in SQL and Tableau will have an advantage.

Job Title: Web Developer (up to S$7000, Proficient in VUE, Angular, React)
Job Description: Develop website and web applications using CSS, HTML, JavaScript, Bootstrap and other scripting/programming languages in the design and implementation of web application projects Provide supports to development projects throughout the project life cycle Provide technical assistane revolving website domain, server monitoring and software installation Perform data analytics and improvise keyword search and content development using tools such as SEO, SEM and Google Adwords
Job Requirements: What Do We Want  Possess at least Degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent At least 2 years of related working experience Proficient in programming framework : VUE , Angular, React Highly skilled in HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Bootstrap Prior exposure to High Concurrency development will be an added advantage

Job Description: ROLE SUMMARY:   As an Senior Marketing Executive, you will be responsible for the planning, development and implementation of marketing activities and campaigns for the events, with the core KPIs of delivering good attendance and attendees’ experience.   PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:   1. Market/list research to build a hygienic and healthy database 2. Plan and execute the entire event’s marketing campaign 3. Preparation and control of budgets 4. Managing of the visitor registration system for its flow and effectiveness, pre-show and on-site, as well as the compilation of statistics and audits 5. Conceptualise, design, provide copy and supervise production of marketing collaterals for events 6. Work with trade media and partners such as trade associations to extend promotional reach 7. Plan and make promotional trips to encourage more trade buyers to visit the events and also to encourage more cross-promotional partnership 8. Conceptualise and manage onsite programmes such as knowledge theatres and technology tours 9. Onsite event management including but not limited to  Supervision of visitor registration areas and temps Supervision of survey temps to ensure quality insights are captured Obtaining exhibitor and visitor quote  10. Management of websites and execution of enewsletters, as well as using the analytics to improve the marketing    campaigns 11. Management of social media sites such as Facebook and Linked In
Job Requirements: POSITION REQUIREMENTS:     Candidate must possess at least Bachelor’s Degree/Post Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in Marketing, Mass Communications or equivalent At least 5 years of working experience in the related field is required for the position Prefer Senior Executive who has experience in Marketing, Events and Digital Marketing Required Skill(s): Excellent communications skills both orally &  in writing, meticulous, self-driven with high levels of initiative, multi-task, deliver quality work within tight deadline, self-starter with an analytical and creative mind Knowledge and ability with IT systems including core MS Office packages (Word, Excel, Power Point, Access)    This job description sets out the duties of the position at the time that it was drawn up. Such duties may vary from time to time per business needs without changing the general character of the duties.

Job Description: about the company  This leading logistic company has an outstanding international reputation in its field and has achieved proven expertise in multiple aspects of supply chain business. They are looking to recruit an Operations Country Focal (3PL/4PL) to help lead the operations team. about the job  As an Operations Country Focal (3PL/4PL), your key tasks involve:  Overall management on day-to-day operations and account management in reviewing KPIs & analytics Inventory optimization and planning Validating and resolve disputes pertaining to invoicing, collections and cost allocation Key contact in maintaining organization methods, performance standards procedures and for customs or trade relates issues Support IT in system performance for billing Foster good relationship with suppliers, customers and distributors who are working closely in & outside of the organization
Job Requirements: skills & experience required To be successful in this position, you must have the ability to demonstrate or possess:  Bachelor Degree in Engineering / Logistics & Supply Chain Management or equivalent Min 5 years of account management experience and handle operations (hands-on) in logistics companies Familiar with Custom Regulations / Local Statutory Requirement Good track record with local suppliers will be an advantage  how to apply To apply online, please click on the ‘apply’ function below. Alternatively, please contact eileen at eileen.goh(@)randstad.com.sg Please indicate your availability, expected salary, and reason for leaving your current job in your CV. EA: 94C3609 / R1880230

Job Description: Circles.Life is Asia’s first and most successful digital telco and we are on a mission to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar industry. We launched our services in 2016 and have been rapidly gaining market share while delivering best in class customer experience. We are leading the market in innovation, customer satisfaction and growth. We have an opening for a Performance Marketing Manager who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure in a hyper-growth environment in Singapore. Do you want to get first-hand insights on how a hyper-growth company operates? Are you interested in being part of a fun, energetic team that thrives in an entrepreneurial tech environment? If the answer is YES, read on to find out more about the role at Circles.Life! Responsibilities Circles.Life is looking for a Performance Marketing Manager who possess superior analytical skills, energy, drive and attention to details. The successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing and organizing big data as well as management reporting duties. As a key member of our team, your responsibilities include:  Custodian of running all performance marketing channels - SEM, Paid Social, Programmatic Display. Monitoring results from web analytics tool and make required optimisations. Support commercial managers of country designated with media planning covering a holistic user journey - audience segments, personalised messaging/experience, activate them across various performance marketing channels. Be the point person to integrate with other media channels and DSP's.  What’s on offer Circles.Life provides a great environment and platform for employees to build their career. In this role, you can expect:  Unique opportunity to be a part of the digital disruption in telecommunication (Circles.Life is the only company of its kind in all of Asia!) Autonomy in the role and in managing your own portfolio Exposure to the fast-paced world of high-tech start-ups Attractive experience and compensation Working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment
Job Requirements: 4 years in Performance marketing and 1 year for managing a team Highly proficient proven experience in Facebook Ads, SEM, DCM, Sizmek Adserver. Knowledge of DSP, Adobe Analytics, DMP, 1st/3rd party data, App install campaigns. Regional exposure in variousr markets (SEA-Region) will be highly-advantageous. Ability to work with various stakeholders, and push-back as and when required. High analytical and able to push internal and external stakeholders to take a data-driven approach to decision making. Passionate for Technology and Disruptive Business Models

Company Name: WOOD MACKENZIE ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
Job Description: Company For the past 45 years, Wood Mackenzie has established its reputation as a leading research and consultancy business for the global energy, chemicals, metals and mining industries. Today we are part of the Verisk family which has broadened our data and analytics platform and strengthened our ability to help clients overcome the toughest challenges with our unrivalled analysis and advice. Together, we inspire and innovate the markets we serve – providing invaluable intelligence that informs the strategic decisions that will ultimately shape the future direction of our global natural resources. Team Profile Wood Mackenzie are a knowledge and relationships business. Through thorough understanding of the industry and client workflows Client Solutions team provides bespoke support and training to the users ensuring that Wood Mackenzie research helps them achieve their unique needs. It is the most client facing team in the organisation allowing its members build strong relationships with the users and be a reliable source of support when it comes to Wood Mackenzie research offerings.   Role Purpose The role of the Client Solutions Specialist is to support the growth in sales (upsell, cross sell, retention & new business development) through understanding clients' workflows and providing a comprehensive bespoke training to ensure that clients extract highest value from Wood Mackenzie's research via increase in both number of users and their usage. Working within Sales and Marketing the Client Solutions Specialist is a key member of individual account teams and will need to work across research and consultancy to ensure a consistent client message is delivered. The role will involve travel within the region. Role Focus and Responsibilities:  Engage directly with clients via training sessions, meetings and other activities to increase users, usage and support cross sell, upsell, retention and new business development in the region Build and maintain a strong network of relationships with key contacts across our user base to understand their roles and workflows Demonstrate excellence in analysing client needs, and creating tailored workflow solutions that maximise the value of Wood Mackenzie content to clients Engage in commercially-focussed client discussions to influence product, service and overall Wood Mackenzie business development Show quantitative and qualitative measures of engagement and training effectiveness, both from a client and commercial perspective Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Research and Consulting teams to ensure consistent best-in-class servicing of our clients Ensure a timely and comprehensive response to client queries Demonstrate creative and efficient approaches to client engagement resulting in the increase of users and usage Record and share all activities, information and materials with colleagues Maintain a thorough working knowledge of Wood Mackenzie research offerings Maintain a thorough knowledge of energy, metals and mining, chemicals and other commodities including the companies active in those industries
Job Requirements: Knowledge & Experience:  Strong presentation, public speaking, and training skills Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Strong working knowledge of the Energy industry 5+ years working as an Energy industry professional Highly self-motivated Excellent English language skills Mandarin speaker preferred  Core Competencies  Client focused  Building and maintaining relationships Assertive and influential Communication Collaboration Determined and resilient  Wood Mackenzie Core Values Wood Mackenzie is a place where we are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment which encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging.  Wood Mackenzie values each individual's contribution and helps them reach their full potential while sustaining an organisational culture of health and well-being. Our core values are:  Respect for the Individual Integrity Passion Persistence Confidence with humility Excellence Teamwork  We understand the importance of bringing your whole self to work and to achieving balance between work, family and other life commitments.  We are open to considering flexible working arrangements to enable the greatest spectrum of talent to contribute to Wood Mackenzie's  success.

Company Name: STARWOOD ASIA PACIFIC HOTELS & RESORTS PTE. LTD.
Job Location: BOA MERR. LYNCH HARBOURFRONT, 2 HARBOURFRONT PLACE 098499
Job Description: Marriott International is the world’s largest hotel company, with more brands, more hotels and more opportunities for associates to grow and succeed. We believe a great career is a journey of discovery and exploration. So, we ask, where will your journey take you? Job Summary As an integral part of the Asia Pacific Total Rewards and HR Technology & Analytics team, the Human Resources Executive provides best-in-class operational support in the areas of compensation, benefits and people data management to fuel Marriott Asia Pacific’s continual growth as the world’s largest hospitality company. You will be actively supporting end-to-end compensation and benefits processes while gaining exposure to people data and reporting work streams. Core Work Activities  Prepare data sets from multiple sources in support of regular and ad hoc reporting, dashboarding and analysis. Manage employee data and documents to ensure accuracy of HR data and records. Support data validation and audits. Prepare employment-related documentation e.g. offer letter, onboarding kit etc. Coordinate and follow up on Compensation & Benefits administration. Support key projects as per request.
Job Requirements: Candidate Profile  0-2 years of Compensation & Benefits/data handling experience. Working experience in a consulting and/or in-house compensation and benefits role will be advantageous. Diploma/Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Human Resources, Informatics/Analytics, Business Administration or Finance from an accredited polytechnic/university. Possess a curious/learning mindset, high meticulousness, excellent service orientation, exceptional interpersonal skills and strong analytical skills. Demonstrate experience/willingness to interact effectively as a team player with co-workers and stakeholders across all levels of the organization. Outstanding MS Office skills, especially in Excel, SharePoint, Access or other similar data management tools. Basic experience working with HR systems, maintaining data and building reports.  Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Marriott International does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, state or local laws.

Job Title: Recruiter, Global Business Operations and Portfolio, Partnerships - Singapore
Job Location: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
Job Description: Company overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: People Operations Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. The role: Recruiter, Global Business Operations and Portfolio, Partnerships - Singapore Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, which allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient. Additional Role Description: In this role, you will work directly with leaders across several business areas on talent planning and recruitment to achieve business objectives. You will be responsible for full life-cycle recruiting. You will use excellent communication skills to tell rich, meaningful stories using data to influence decisions. You will balance creativity, drive, and interpersonal skills.   As Recruiter within GBOP in Singapore, you will manage the functional hiring strategy and an annual staffing plan for your organization and maintain effective client relationships. By leveraging your knowledge of our clients' hiring needs, candidate market supply and diversity expectations, you’ll effectively match candidates with the roles in which they will be most successful. You’ll engage your business group to drive referrals, increase interview participation, and create a sense of shared responsibility for hiring talent. In this role, you will be the main staffing point of contact for a large, APAC-wide portfolio. You will drive hiring strategy, execution, and reporting through close partnership with executive stakeholders while providing guidance and support to other recruiters across the region. Responsibilities: - Implement staffing business strategy to achieve an annual hiring plan that emphasizes quality and diversity. - Demonstrate positive influence on agreed site-wide strategy and Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) focus areas. D&I strategy and initiatives cross-functions and set and deliver clear D&I milestones and effectively engage leadership. - Deliver regular business reviews to clients. Provide overall hiring efficiency and insights into strategic initiatives in the context of organizational needs and talent gaps. - Ensure a joined people plan and contribute to overall people strategy to meet goals. Partner with Global and regional points of contact (POCs) to ensure alignment on annual plan.  - Engage talent and achieve quarterly hiring goals. Provide a high-touch experience for every candidate from application stage to offer.
Job Requirements: Minimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. - Experience in recruiting, staffing operations, HR or related area. Preferred qualifications: - Ability to solve problems based on information provided with attention to detail. - Ability to develop recommendations and implement solutions to promote ongoing improvements to recruitment efforts based on client needs. - Ability to maintain confidence and professionalism when leading others through ambiguous and complex situations. - Ability to clearly communicate in discussions and written documents and deliver regular updates and feedback clearly and tactfully. - Ability to influence and negotiate diplomatically and fairly with a diverse range of stakeholders. - Excellent teamwork, communication and customer service skills.

Job Location: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
Job Description: The Multi-region Sales Support & Operations Senior Manager is a leadership role, responsible for  delivering regional Sales Support to End User Sellers in their efforts to drive bookings and revenue, by supporting special pricing, RFP/RFI administration, providing sellers with business analytics, maintaining account data in CRM in addition to a variety of ad hoc administrative and operational activities managing support functions essential to sales force productivity and attainment of goals.  These include business reviews and planning, reporting, quota setting and management, sales process optimization, sales program and training implementation, sales compensation administration, revenue maximization  The role will report into the APAC Head of Sales Operations. Regions covered are Australia/New Zealand, South East Asia + Korea (SEAK), and India. Responsibilities: This leadership role is responsible for the creation and deployment of operational business process, delivered through a team of Regional End User Sales Support Specialists. Processes include (but are not limited to) RFI/RFPs, Pricing approvals, Buy Backs & Trade-Ins, POC and Try & Buy, CRM KPIs, Customer Data Management, general Administration and Reporting support for Sales. The role requires orchestration and building of strong peer support across other functional teams in Finance, Marketing, Pricing, Product, Supply Chain and Operation
Job Requirements: 10+ years’ experience working in Sales Operations, Sales Support or Sales in APAC countries. High-Tech industry experience working in companies that go-to-market through a complex distribution / reseller (or retailer) channel and familiar with common sales processes associated with this type of business. Experience in creating and managing Business Processes that deliver value to Sales whilst meeting key stakeholder requirements. Strong leadership skills and minimum 2 years people management experience. Working knowledge SalesForce CRM Confident presenting analysis in a concise way to senior sales management teams. Proven ability to work effectively with and influence diverse stakeholders across sales, marketing, finance and IT at various levels of the organisation. Excellent planning and time management skills with the ability to manage multiple deliverables to tight timelines. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high-attention to detail. Advanced Excel skills. Fluent in English (company language). Preferred: MBA

Job Description: www.gigco.work www.simonestudios.com We are a Property Technology ( Prop-Tech) company looking to hire Property Executive / Property Agents to join our dynamic, creative and innovative team.  We are looking forward to developing and nurturing the next generation property executive/ agents with critical leadership and soft skills. He/She plays a crucial role as a central point for both buyers/tenants and sellers to transact within our leap frogging yet innovative property portal. Job Location: SINGAPORE WINE VAULT BUILDING, 6 FISHERY PORT ROAD 619747
Job Description: As one of the fastest growing e-commerce companies in Asia, RedMart offers an unparalleled startup experience. Our culture: entrepreneurial, fiercely intelligent, team oriented, deeply creative and whatever you add to it!  We’re fanatical about improving our customer experience and providing “wow” customer service.   Product Designers play a vital role inside our organisation. You will be working with cross-functional teams in RedMart to ensure that our RedMart website and apps provides an awesome shopping experience for our customers.   What we look for in a candidate?   You believe that every product is built to be part of a design system, made of reusable components and patterns to efficiently function within a platform. Your portfolio has some of best-in-class craftsmanship, solved by the marriage of a good user experience and proper functionality. Your designs are clean, elegant and aesthetically sound.   You’re not afraid to design in the open. You should be very comfortable in showing incomplete work with the team. At RedMart, we share work-in-progress design solutions work regularly within the team. This ensures that you are always on-track and moving in the right direction.   You’ve shipped products. You understand that every product, new or existing, is made through constant iteration, driven by data informing your decisions, insights and observations translating into meaningful action. You know how to inspire and collaborate with engineers to build products that have business impact without compromising on design integrity.   You never stop learning. You are aware that this business requires constant self-learning. From design trends, to new software like Sketch or prototyping tools that is constantly changing. On a personal level, you are not afraid to unlearn existing behaviors to experiment on new ones. Bottom line, you are always looking for the possibility of being wrong and open towards doing the right thing.   You are willing to do what it takes to understand and solve problems. You know that understanding the problem intimately is crucial to solving it well. On some days, you might be conducting an observational user study to understand how customers use a new feature, or you might be analysing Google Analytics data to understand why this feature is not performing as well as expected. You are also able to articulate your findings back to the team and come up with actionable recommendations.
Job Requirements: The hygiene stuff: - Enjoy moving fast: we don't wait for things to happen in RedMart - Be able to design the fine grained details of interactions - Be able to effectively and concisely communicate ideas  - Be able to prototype designs in lo-fidelity and hi-fidelity as required - Be familiar in designing for mobile and web - Be proficient in Sketch or Adobe Photoshop   Years of experience in the Product Design field does not matter here, but we are looking for an individual that embodies the qualities above. As part of your application, we would like to see your online portfolio or PDF portfolio.

Job Description: Key Responsibilities: As Business Development Manager, you are responsible for driving key account sales and revenue growth of the Company’s digital marketing and advertising sales business. Your key responsibilities are:  Acquire leads and converting sales. Manage client relationships. Digital marketing advocacy and education for clients. Achieve targeted sales metrics, and provide weekly channel reporting to management. Deep-dive analytics and reports to uncover strategic insights, optimization and action plans.
Job Requirements: Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:  Advanced digital marketing knowledge and experience in developing strategy and execution across various platforms and industries. Performance and digital marketing sales experience across various industries. Strong track record in introducing new solutions to the market and converting new leads. Strong data and analytical skills.  Requirements:    Minimum two (2) years of experience e in Digital Marketing sales. University degree in business studies/marketing/communications. Excellent analytical and problem solving skills in selling performance marketing solutions such as programmatic, search, social, mobile, etc. Proven track record in sales, digital strategy, planning and implementation. Excellent attention to detail. Excellent presentation, writing and verbal skills. Comfortable working independently, as well as part of the team. Proven ability to work under pressure. Problem solver who takes initiative to get things done. An enthusiastic go-getter.

Job Description: Job Responsibilities:  Responsible for full spectrum of payroll activities including payroll reconciliation, reports and analytics. Ensuring payroll timelines and accuracy are met for all salary paid out. Ensure that all payroll processing and practices are in compliance with local statutory legislation and company policies. Maintain and ensure that all employee and salary data are accurately update into in-house payroll software. Verify and process ad-hoc payment (i.e. incentive, split shift, medical incentive and etc). Responsible for statutory payment submission like CPF, IR8A, IR21, MOM and related market surveys, childcare leaves, maternity leaves, paternity leaves and NS Claims. Assisting compensation and benefits functions such as salary benchmarking, participation in salary and statutory surveys, benefit review and renewal. Administer for in-house time attendance records and ensure all employees records & attendance are well capture in the system. Keep track all employees’ leave records and update to the HOD on monthly basis. Serve as a link between management and employees by handling all payroll related matters promptly. Involve in enhancement of payroll-related work processes. Generate manpower cost and analytic report for management review. Assisting in internal and external payroll audit. Ensure that all payroll records are well documented and filling. Perform any other ad-hoc duties as assigned by management.
Job Requirements: Job Requirements  Candidates possess at least Diploma / Degree in Human Resource Management or related field; Candidates possess minimum 3 years of relevant working experience in F&B industry will be add advantage; Possess in-depth knowledge of statutory requirements (Eg. Employment Act, CPF Act, Income Tax Regulations and etc.); Meticulous, detailed and able to handle confidential information; Strong interpersonal skills and possess a hands-on and positive working attitude; Good analytical skills with a high proficiency in MS Excel & Word will be a plus; Ability to work under pressure and to thrive in a fast pace environment; A team player with initiative and who is able to work independently; Bilingual In English & Mandarin will be a great advantage (to liaise with associates); Available to start within short notice preferred.

Job Type: Part Time, Permanent, Contract, Full Time

He/She supports execution of performance management programmes and benefits plans. He/She should be able to make objective comparison of the organisation's compensation and benefits programmes with other organisations.   He/She helps ensures office regulations are followed as well as performs data analytics and shares insights reports with the Heads of other departments.   He/She works well in a team environment, and is able to communicate well with various stakeholders. To be successful in this role, you should have an extensive background in Human Resources departments and thorough knowledge of labor legislation. Ultimately, you will make make recommendations so that we hire, develop and retain qualified employees.
