Job Title: Demand Planning Manager, Human Pharma, ROPU South East Asia and South Korea
Job Description: Description: This position oversees, manages and steers all demand planning activitise in the Human Pharma busines unit across the South East Asia and South Korea (SEASK) region for customers across a range of SKUs and product categories/species and thereby coordinates cross-functional inputs from sales and marketing and other sources to ensure optimized service levels and efficient inventory management. This position is located in Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) Singapore office and reports to the Head of Commerical Supply Chain Management, ROPU SEASK. Duties & Responsbilities: - Manage replenishment planning activities within the Regional Operative Unit (ROPU) by:  Performing net requirement (GRP) planning & coordinate with global suppliers on the timely shipment and delivery of the requirements. Managing direct link (DL) response and alert monitor handling  - Maintain SKU replenishment master data with alignment and agreement with local Operative Units (OPUs) (Safety Stock, EOQ, EOC, Demand and Shipment Consolidation, Mode of Transportation) - Manage the collaborative forecasting and replenishment process to alighn BI and customer plans on key events. - Pro-actively manage the alignment of JDA/ APO with global CSCM contacts - Act as Product Life Cycle Management for the ROPU  Facilitate analytics-based OPU portfolio management/ rationalization process Measure key performance indicators to track and evaluate demand planning process Prepre analysis, reports and statistics related to Demand Planning and forecasting function  -Oversee Launch and Change Planning:  Ensure logistic preparation and execution in prepration of launch ad change implemenation (SLCI work items) Coordinate the launch and change activities with Global and Local OPU Team to ensure timely launch and change implementation  - Pivotal role working with S&OP cycle, facilitating the creation a robust demand forecast at SKU/week level across the operating horizon, by working closely with customer and commerical and supply chain contacts.
Job Requirements: University Degree of Bachelor or equivalent. MSc / MBA will be advantage Certificate (preferred): APICS/ CPIM Proven capability in Demand Planning Management in life science industry mandatory In-depth understanding of and /or experience in supply chain management and systems; with at least 8 years of work experience in Supply Chain or Commercial function Experience in Demand Planning function within a manufacturing environment Experience in logistics and distribution (inbound to last miles distribution) would be beneficial Strong performance focus and driving a continuous improvement mindset Proven capability on working in the matrix organization. Excellent analytical capabilities to interpret information and reports Ability to manage complexity whilst being comfortable with ambiguity Attention to detail and high level of accuracy Experience in SAP APO/ JDA Knowledge and use of MS Excel for analytics and mass data processing Proficient in English and excellent communication skills Effective negotiator with excellent presentation skills (oral and written)

Job Description: Develop predictive models and offerings that are integrated with overall programme stages and objectives. Support the development of non-quantitative models and frameworks, including behavioural and psychometrics models. Work with peers outside immediate organization to define and characterise complex technology or process problems and/or develops new solutions, yet works independently to drive technical problems to a solution. Collect, cleanse and transform data from multiple data sources for report generation and visualization. Work hand in hand with the campaign specialists/planners to create and execute programmes that follow on from the E.P.I.C purpose-based planning approach. Participate in workgroups as assigned, providing analytics data and insights to inform digital marketing initiatives. Experience in development and deployment of applications running on public cloud systems such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform is desirable Experience working in Neural Network and other Deep Learning techniques is a plus Support sales efforts, including prospecting, research, proposal development, and sales pitches.
Job Requirements: Qualifications You should have 1 to 2 years of professional experience and a Bachelor of Science or equivalent degree in computer science or statistics, proficiency with Microsoft Office, excellent organization skills, and the ability to adapt to change and meet deadlines. You must have a strong work ethic and dedication to consistently provide quality work. Previous internship experience is preferred.    The ideal candidate should have:  Experience in data gathering, data cleansing, data manipulation, data integration and data analysis. Experience in relational and non-relational database systems, proficient in querying using SQL. Experience in scripting languages, such as Python. Experience in data visualization and dashboarding tools, such as Domo, Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI. Experience in integrating various tools and solutions using interfaces, such as RESTful API. Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills.  The candidate must be able to present technical and non-technical information to both senior management and peers in a clear, concise manner. Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects. Excellent team player, experience working with cross-functional teams. Entrepreneurial spirit, self starter, comfortable with ambiguity and uncertainty.

Job Description: Digital arm of English, Malay, Tamil MediaGroup within SPH group specialises in making the news stories exciting with the stunning interactive features. The team is looking for Data Visualisation Designer If you are passionate for journalism, data and design and take initiative to devise original and imaginative ways to tell visual stories, you may the one we are looking for. Data Visualisation Designer would be expected to work closely with journalists, developers, designers, and editors on a daily basis.  Come up with data visualisation design through interactive infographics Carry out investigative journalism/research with journalists using data, including conducting interviews and finding/verifying data sources Demonstrate editorial judgement, creativity and flair Work with front-end web developers to produce interesting and innovative visual stories Use various statistics and data science tools for data parsing, scraping and wrangling Manage workflow and process for data-driven stories in the newsroom Use analytics to evaluate stories and propose changes to workflow, concepts
Job Requirements: Prior experience in a data visualization role Strong analytical and critical thinking skills Familiar with the latest digital storytelling trends Familiar with the common data APIs, facebook graph API, google API Bachelor’s degree in data science, mathematics, statistics, computer science strongly preferred Experienced with one or more common databases, SQL, scripting languages (R, Python, Perl) Working knowledge of interactive data storytelling/visualization tools (Tableau, Microsoft Excel) and web infrastructure (JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery) an advantage Experience in journalism (including internship) is an advantage  Please apply with your updated CV and design portfolio.

Job Description: “There is no love sincerer than the love of food.” - George Bernard Shaw Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you will definitely love foodpanda! foodpanda (small ‘f’) is the world’s favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it’s getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again. However this doesn’t happen without some really awesome people. We are looking for a Data Engineer, to support our growing regional Product team here in Singapore as part of an international team of highly talented and motivated people. This position will evaluate business opportunities to define and optimize the product portfolio through analysis and understanding of internal data, shared services centre, targeted markets, market trends, new technology, customer business issues and the competitive environment. In addition, this role will apply broad knowledge of product capabilities and service offerings with an in-depth analysis of market position to create and expand the foodpanda portfolio. You will be part of the Regional Product Management team, wherein you will work with Product managers on various business problems. You will work cross-functionally with multiple departments and business units across our APAC locations to create products and validates early product definitions with customers. There will be significant levels of interaction with customers, account management, Operations, Logistics, Contact centre and the Global BI team based in Berlin. Using technical expertise and industry experience, this position formulates product strategies and identifies new product opportunities and will also ensure alignment of a roadmap to customer needs and business goals, to include overseeing successful product market acceptance, launch, enhancement and end-of-life while managing the business performance of the product through the lifecycle.  Responsibilities:  Tracking & QA: Determine what needs to be tracked and measured. You will be responsible for maintenance of Tracking Tools and Tag Management System and the quality of our data. Product Strategy: Evaluate and define product and business KPIs and metrics (KPI workshops). Data visualization: Democratize data by building and socializing customized dashboards & reports across all product teams Analytics: Offer deep dive analysis to key stakeholders across all teams and products, in order to determine the next hypotheses for our UX optimization strategy
Job Requirements: Required Experience:  You have more than 4 years of experience specifically in Digital Analytics using the mentioned tools and technologies, preferably in e-commerce. You have concrete cases of analysis, experimentation and KPI definition preferably in an e-commerce context that you can share with us during the hiring process. Google Analytics (Preferably IQ certified) Mastery in other tracking technologies can be used as an alternative e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture, SnowPlow. QA technologies: Observepoint etc. Google Tag Manager or other TMS system. BigQuery; alternatively strong SQL knowledge. Understanding of web and mobile development technologies for both front-end and back-end, especially a strong understanding of JavaScript, HTML, CSS.

Job Description: Experience working with business users to concept, generate and deliver data management solutions, dashboards and reporting . Working knowledge of BI (business intelligence) or analytics tools required
Job Requirements: Good experience in HADOOP IS REQUIRED Working knowledge of data visualization: ie. Tableau, QlikView Knowledge of Big data and Hadoop Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server and/or Oracle databases is preferred SSIS/SSRS required

Job Description: Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques. Incorporate data analytics capabilities and features into Ecquaria line of products. The person will need to work with various teams in Ecquaria, chiefly, Product team and the Sales team. The person is expected to be customer facing for sales related initiatives to create mind share with prospects. The person is also expected to work with external organizations such as 3rd party companies.
Job Requirements: Degree in Computer Science, Information Management or Mathematics. Strong knowledge in database design, data modeling, data mining, machine learning. Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, R, Matlab, etc.). Ability to work independently to innovate and develop prototypes to demonstrate the feasibility of ideas Possess good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills

Job Description: Our global audience analytics team helps clients identify their highest value prospects and customers, and deliver relevant messages to those people using a census-level data stack and advanced tools for custom audience creation, extension (via look-alike models), and syndication to activation platforms.   These capabilities represent a critical part of our current business, with very strong growth potential.  The team objective is to accelerate our growth, delivering strong revenue gains by attracting new clients and delighting current clients to retain and expand their engagement.   The Manager, Audience Insights and Measurement supports this goal by supervising the junior staff through high-quality delivery and reporting on projects including audience segmentation, look-alike modeling, audience syndication to advanced or addressable TV platforms, and closed-loop measurement of media outcomes (reach, frequency, sales impact, etc.).   Essential Functions  Independently manipulate multiple sources of data to analyze the state our clients’ businesses across multiple dimensions (transactional, brand equity, search interest, website visits, social media, advertising activity and geo-locational) Develop advanced SQL queries to compile, assess and query competitive advertising media intelligence Train a cross functional team of data scientists, media researchers, analytics and strategist on how to create custom audiences for clients Create Advanced Dashboards using a variety of data visualization tools and use SQL queries to generate reports and dashboards in Tableau data analytics. Apply independent critical thinking to analyze vast data sets to uncover media insights, what’s working, what’s not working. Participate in brainstorming sessions with communication planners, creative assets, media planners, buyers, clients and other partner agencies Contribute to the overall capabilities and understanding of advanced TV in our team and with agency partners Conduct data profiling to better understand business needs of each client’s media account.  Respond to ad-hoc data feed requests from various agency teams Serve as audience lead on new business pitches Experience with leading training Ability to work independently
Job Requirements: Qualifications   Education:  Bachelor’s degree with graduate degree preferred  Work Experience:  Must have experience working with large datasets to uncover insights that are essential to business optimizations At least 2-3 years of previous relevant experience with at least 1-2 year of supervisory experience 3 or more year of experience in programming and relational database work  Skills:  Ability to manage complete deliverables and work with minimal supervision Programming experience in the following: SAS, R, or Python for mathematical or data operations (not just Python for front-end) is a must Experience with data providers such as Acxiom, Experian, Comscore, ResearchNow, YouGov, GroundTruth, Pushspring and Gracenotes Understand the role that DMPs and DSPs play in the role of online, offline and programmatic media activation Previous experience building multivariate statistics models including K-mean clustering, decision tree and random forest lookalike models Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau is preferred Strong written and verbal communication

Job Description: Conduct fundamental research on Base Metals and Tech Materials and/ or Steel Building and maintaining all supply/demand information Conducting price analysis (price distribution/seasonally/spreads/arbitrage) Gathering market intelligence Developing quantitative models for price forecasting Communicating results frequently to key stakeholders in a timely and comprehensive manner Understanding macroeconomic and geopolitical factors as a key drivers for individual commodity markets Compile databases/information for traders Support trader in their market analysis and requests Making Analytics the driver of trading decisions.
Job Requirements: Present updated supply/demand analysis at all times Provide consistent and relevant timely information on key market factors to drive trading decisions/results Communicate closely with stakeholders for feedback and improvements  Education and Qualifications: Bachelors in Economics or Financial Engineering. Master’s is preferred. Experience: At least 8  years of relevant experience from a commodities trading house, production house or leading financial institution. Skills: High proficiency in Excel. Experience with data manipulation/statistical software, and knowledge in Excel VBA Macros is desirable

Job Description: About GoBear We don’t usually toot our own horn but (seeing as you might work here soon) we thought you might like to know GoBear is Asia’s first and only metasearch engine for financial products. We spend our days trying to figure out how to make comparing insurance and banking products as awesome as possible. Our happy place is where users don’t even have to think twice – they can choose a financial product that’s right for them and feel confident with their choice (we know that’s a nerdy happy place, but we can’t help what we love). We’re looking for people who break the mould; who’ve got a hankering to do something completely different. Obviously we want our bears to be smart and hardworking but, more importantly, we want people on our team who love technology, who love their job, and who aren’t afraid to fail while trying something completely crazy. Oh, and if you have a chuckle while reading WYSIWYG,#companykarma, GSD and “If you don’t listen to your customers, someone else will.”, then you’ll fit right into the team. If that all sounds up your alley, then read on.                                                                         Who’s who in the zoo? Reporting directly to the Chief Product Officer – Singapore, you’ll lead a team of three people managers, who own the design and structure of the integrated User Experience, and you’ll get to hang out with folks in the Product and Design teams.   What fun you’ll get to have at GoBear?  You’ll have end to end responsibility of the customer including renewal management and all CRM activities You’ll own the customer journey and customer interaction within the marketplace You’ll have full ownership of and manage the end to end funnel setup and analytics You’ll own the design and structure of the integrated UX experience, Website, APP and external services You’ll be responsible for competitor analysis through user studies, online surveys  and how we can improve overall UX experience
Job Requirements: Got Skills?                                                                                            You have 8+ years experience in consumer research and innovation in online or e-commerce industry You have a Bachelor's degree in Social Sciences, Science, or Engineering or similar/related fields You have great communication and presentation skills, with experience in project management You have demonstrated strong leadership with large teams. You have excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communications skills, including the ability to communicate concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences including executive management.   Does this sound like you?  You’re kind You have thinking ability to drive implementation and follow through  You are independent, dynamic and not scared of a fast pace You are a flexible team player within a multicultural team You’re kind (yes I said it again!)    Need more reasons to come and work for us? You’ll get to learn from a multicultural team of FinTech disruptors at one of the fastest growing online brands in Asia. Our work makes us innovative, agile, brave and result-driven but we also just love what we do – and because we love what we do, we’re fun to be around (well, we think so anyway). We’ve got an open and transparent culture so what you see is what you get: we’re not cool with office politics. We value freedom and high performance above blindly following processes. In fact, we like it when you challenge our processes. We also like it when you show curiosity for new ideas that make a difference. And, we love it when you discover practical solutions to tough problems. We give lots of high fives for solving tough problems. You can leave your car at home because we’ve got a neat office in the heart of CBD, just a few steps away from Raffles Place MRT.

Job Title: Senior Associate, Data and Analytics, Advisory
Job Description: Powered by big data and advanced technologies, insights from analytics are disrupting everything from how companies create competitive advantage to day-to-day business processes. But companies don’t have analytics problems; they have business problems that analytics can address.  Our view is that the human element is just as critical as technology and data to realizing true value from analytics.  This involves individual and organizational considerations that become the bridge from data to insights to action.      The opportunity  As a Senior Consultant, you will deliver value-added services to our clients and you are required to be a specialist in managing both structured and unstructured enterprise data and deliver analytics-related solutions to Ernst & Young clients across Asean.  In addition, you are required to communicate effectively with the project manager & team members in the region regarding the progress of the project and be a role model to the team members in exhibiting the Ernst & Young best practices.  At Ernst & Young, the true value lies in embedding analytics deeply into business processes at the point of where decisions are made – by human beings.   Your key responsibility:   This is a role where no two days are the same – so you’ll find yourself taking on plenty of new responsibilities as you go. You’ll work alongside clients and colleagues, balancing your time between developing security strategies, advising stakeholders, providing workshops and supporting business development. If you’re flexible and ready to adapt to a constantly changing environment, there’s no better place to develop your skills. Since you’ll be working directly with clients, some travel will be required.  Skills and attributes for success  Analytical and problem-solving skills combined with experience in leveraging data analytics to drive insights and business decisions.  Analyze client’s business and supply chain requirements Develop supply chain optimization models and statistical analysis using packaged as well as custom optimization software tools (e.g. LLamasoft Supply Chain Guru, LLamasoft Transportation Guru, SAS, R, Python, GAMS)  Analyze and interpret optimization results and derive insights  Communicate technical insight from analytics and modeling to senior executives in a business-oriented and pragmatic way  Provide critical thinking and subject-matter expertise to quantitative and qualitative aspects of client engagements Strong attention to details and ability to multi-task. A strong work ethic. A willingness to travel to meet client needs; travel is estimated at 20%.
Job Requirements: To qualify for the role you must have  BS in Engineering or Computer Sciences 3- 7 years of working experience in consulting, analytics software-as-a-service or technology industry. Strong experience in solving supply chain planning and design problems using quantitative approaches Working knowledge of commercial network design tools such LLamasoft SCG, IBM LNP or similar  Advanced data analysis and processing skills in MS Access, Excel, and SQL Familiarity with custom optimization engines such as GAMS, LINDO, CPLEX Working knowledge on a statistical package such as SAS, SPSS, R or Python  Working knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, QlikView or any other BI solution. Strong understanding of supply chain design levers and metrics Understanding of supply chain planning at strategic, tactical and operational level  Fundamental understanding of science behind optimization Articulate, with excellent oral and written communication skills. Adaptable, able to interact and build strong relationships with people from a diverse range of backgrounds. Intellectually rigorous, with strong analytical skills and a passion for data. Sound logical reasoning and deep thinking ability. Ability to work accurately to a high level of detail.  Ideally, you’ll also have  MS in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Decision Sciences, Engineering or Computer Sciences (preferred) Supply Chain certifications such as CSCP / CPIM are a plus  We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social wellbeing. Plus, we offer:    What working at EY offers We’re interested in flexible professionals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritise shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. You’ll also need the confidence to give professional advice and guidance to colleagues and clients from a diverse range of cultures, often with limited information – both verbally and in writing. If you’re a fast learner, with strong influencing skills and a genuine passion for information system security, this role is for you.   What we look for  Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues around. Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career. The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you.    About us   EY is a global professional services organisation providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are committed to doing our part in building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. And we are united by our shared values and a dedication to delivering exceptional client service.   Want to get to know us better?  Visit www.ey.com/SG/careers  Become a fan on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/EYSGcareers  Connect with us on Linked In: http://bit.ly/EYLinked_Careers  Watch us on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/ernstandyoungglobal    We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.  © 2017 Ernst & Young Advisory Pte. Ltd. All Rights Reserved.

Since you’ll be working directly with clients, some travel will be required.  Skills and attributes for success  Analytical and problem-solving skills combined with experience in leveraging data analytics to drive insights and business decisions.  Analyze client’s business and supply chain requirements Develop supply chain optimization models and statistical analysis using packaged as well as custom optimization software tools (e.g. LLamasoft Supply Chain Guru, LLamasoft Transportation Guru, SAS, R, Python, GAMS)  Analyze and interpret optimization results and derive insights  Communicate technical insight from analytics and modeling to senior executives in a business-oriented and pragmatic way  Provide critical thinking and subject-matter expertise to quantitative and qualitative aspects of client engagements Strong attention to details and ability to multi-task. A strong work ethic. A willingness to travel to meet client needs; travel is estimated at 20%.
Job Requirements: To qualify for the role you must have  BS in Engineering or Computer Sciences 1 - 3 years of working experience in consulting, analytics software-as-a-service or technology industry. Strong experience in solving supply chain planning and design problems using quantitative approaches Working knowledge of commercial network design tools such LLamasoft SCG, IBM LNP or similar  Advanced data analysis and processing skills in MS Access, Excel, and SQL Familiarity with custom optimization engines such as GAMS, LINDO, CPLEX Working knowledge on a statistical package such as SAS, SPSS, R or Python  Working knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, QlikView or any other BI solution. Strong understanding of supply chain design levers and metrics Understanding of supply chain planning at strategic, tactical and operational level  Fundamental understanding of science behind optimization Articulate, with excellent oral and written communication skills. Adaptable, able to interact and build strong relationships with people from a diverse range of backgrounds. Intellectually rigorous, with strong analytical skills and a passion for data. Sound logical reasoning and deep thinking ability. Ability to work accurately to a high level of detail.  Ideally, you’ll also have  MS in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Decision Sciences, Engineering or Computer Sciences (preferred) Supply Chain certifications such as CSCP / CPIM are a plus  We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social wellbeing. Plus, we offer:    What working at EY offers We’re interested in flexible professionals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritise shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. You’ll also need the confidence to give professional advice and guidance to colleagues and clients from a diverse range of cultures, often with limited information – both verbally and in writing. If you’re a fast learner, with strong influencing skills and a genuine passion for information system security, this role is for you.   What we look for  Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues around. Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career. The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you.    About us   EY is a global professional services organisation providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are committed to doing our part in building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. And we are united by our shared values and a dedication to delivering exceptional client service.   Want to get to know us better?  Visit www.ey.com/SG/careers  Become a fan on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/EYSGcareers  Connect with us on Linked In: http://bit.ly/EYLinked_Careers  Watch us on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/ernstandyoungglobal    We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.  © 2017 Ernst & Young Advisory Pte. Ltd. All Rights Reserved.

Job Location: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 12 MARINA BOULEVARD 018982
Job Industry: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Banking and Finance
Job Description: Principal Adviser Market Risk Analytics   ·         Opportunity to work in a world class organization ·         Exposure to global operations, processes and stakeholders ·         Work in a collaborative and fast paced environment   About the role   We are looking for a Principle Advisor Market Risk Analytics to work closely with the business to build leading risk management structures and systems to support commercial activities. ·         Understand Market Risk Management concepts, models, instruments, and exposures (e.g. time spread, basis risk, non-linear products) ·         Articulate and with an ability to document areas of market risk, limits, and weaknesses  ·         Develop Market Risk models ·         Develop specs/procedures necessary to validate model parameters and performance. ·         Develop an in house Trading system/solution by incorporating market risk models. This includes the quantitative and qualitative aspects of market risk management, performance validation and stress testing. ·         Project mange the system implementation. ·         Keep up to date with technical and industry developments in the field of risk model design, development, validation, stress testing, and general regulatory requirements. ·         Ability to manage risk across global portfolio of commodities.
Job Requirements: To succeed in this role, you will have: Qualifications and experience    At least 8 years relevant experience in a market risk management environment with strong technical skills and/or model developer capacity. Masters (or Ph.D.) degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Financial Engineering or Applied Finance Exposure to front office and trading positions Good understanding of financial instruments Exposure to physical commodities trading is an advantage    Other requirements:  Advanced knowledge and coding abilities in Python and Excel Strong analytical skills Strong problem solving skills Entrepreneurial, can-do attitude  and self-motivated Ability to talk proactively and influence trading strategies A team player who is also able to work independently and meet tight deadlines    Where you will be working   The Commercial group is focused on maximising the value of our products; growing value in the marketplace through partnership with the company’s customers, suppliers, product groups and Group functions.  Headquartered in Singapore, and integrated with Rio Tinto’s assets, hubs, and offices globally, the Commercial group provides the commercial insights to drive value along the mine-to-market value chain. The Commercial group incorporates and utilises the knowledge and capabilities of our global Sales & Marketing, Procurement, and Marine & Logistics organisations, supported by the Market Analysis, Commercial Treasury and other functions, to ensure our approach to business is driven by a commercially-astute and innovative mind-set. The Commercial group came under the leadership of the newly appointed chief commercial officer on 1 January 2018.   As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress. Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents. Aluminium and copper, diamonds, gold and industrial minerals, iron ore, coal and uranium: our materials make up the world around us. You’ll find then in smartphones, planes, cars, hospitals and throughout your home.   Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce   We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career. Please note, in order to be successfully considered for a role you must complete all pre-screening questions.

Job Title: AVP, Data Scientist, Business Analytics, Consumer Banking Group (180004XI)
Job Location: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 12 MARINA BOULEVARD 018982
Job Description: Business Function  As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.    About this role    The Regional Data Science team is part of the Regional Business Analytics team for Consumer Banking Group. Our responsibilities include building the Data Science Solutions using advanced machine learning methods, recommendation engines, text mining solutions and customer models to increase the business impact and efficient customer management, as well as answer numerous business questions using statistical tools and data analysis.   Responsibilities     Involve in building cutting edge algorithms and working with state-of-art data science and machine learning tools such as Spark, Tensor Flow and will have mastery in any number of analytic platforms like SAS, SQL, Python, R. etc. Work with large scale datasets, distributed Big Data Platforms for a variety of advanced analytics solutions across the Bank ranging from recommendation engines, Propensity models, customer segmentation, Graph models, pricing and more. Work alongside BA Leadership, making regular presentation to senior management including C-level executives within the Consumer Bank Leadership across the region Help the team with methodology and guidance in the areas of experiment design and data analysis.
Job Requirements: Masters or equivalent degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operation Research, or equivalent quantitative fields preferred. Strong mathematical and statistics background. 6-10 years of experience in industry (ideally consumer banking, ecommerce, telecoms, retail) and/or academia with demonstrated track record of innovative research and insight generation and implementation of insights into tools/processes delivering front end business results  At least 5 years of data mining and machine learning on large amount of data, building and implementing various statistical models. Good understanding of technology tools especially those related to analytics, data & statistical modelling.  Programming experience in SAS (Base, Stats, Macro, EG, EM), R, Python, Spark, Tensorflow or other statistical programing software.  Familiarity with Hadoop, Hive, and Pig. Proficient in using databases like Teradata, Oracle, SQL Server, Neo4J etc.. Knowledge of internet marketing data collection and metrics as well as familiarity with digital analytics platforms like Google Adwords, Facebook Contextual marketing, Omniture/Adobe, Mediaplex, etc would be helpful. Ability to communicate complex analysis/models across a diverse team. Good written and oral communication skills

Job Industry: Education and Training, Sciences / Laboratory / R&D
Job Description: 1. Work with Industry Partners in Challenging Business Analytics Projects  Work with BAC industry partners to conduct applied research projects Collaborate with BAC industry partners to collect business requirements, design and develop analytics and optimization solutions Design and develop innovative analytics and optimization models and algorithms to solve the challenging business problems; Publish papers/industry reports and file patents in analytics areas
Job Requirements: Good knowledge in Operations Research and Mathematical Optimization areas, e.g. Mixed Integer Programming (MIP), LP (Linear Programming), NLP (Non-linear Programming), Meta-heuristic search algorithms, etc. Good knowledge in transforming business requirements into mathematical models Good knowledge in manufacturing systems and supply chain planning areas Good knowledge in commercial optimization tools, e.g. IBM Cplex optimization studio, Gurobi, Fico Xpress, etc. Other analytics knowledge is big plus, e.g. machine learning, simulation, visualization, etc. Excellent communication skills Able to confidently deal with different level staffs from top tier MNCs Willing to go the 'extra mile' for BAC industry partners Ability to build rapport Time management and planning skills Able to travel to oversea based on project requirements Minimum university degree holder; Masters and PhDs are welcome to apply

Job Description: Company Overview Intellect Minds is a Singapore-based company since 2008, specializing in talent acquisition, application development, and training. We serve BIG MNCs and well-known clients in talent acquisition, application development, and training needs for Singapore, Malaysia, Brunei, Vietnam and Thailand. Our client is an establish company a, leader within their industry, is now looking for a Data Engineer to join their esteemed organization. Job Descriptions: Responsibilities • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture. • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. • Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, Cassandra, Hadoop and other Big Data Technologies. • Build data pipeline on premise and on Google Cloud Platform. • Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics. • Work with stakeholders including the Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. • Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Job Requirements: Qualifications • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases. • Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets. • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement. • Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets. • Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management. • A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets. • Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores. • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment. • We are looking for a candidate with 5+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role, who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. They should also have experience using the following software/tools: • Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc. • Experience with Google Cloud Platform esp. Google Pub-Sub, Big Query, Data Proc, Data Flow, Cloud Storage. • Experience with IoT & Time series data. • Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra. • Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc. • Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc. All successful candidates can expect a very competitive remuneration package and a comprehensive range of benefits. Interested Candidates please submit your detailed resume online. To your success! The Recruitment Team Intellect Minds Pte Ltd (Singapore)

Job Description: Role Summary  Define the regional marketing strategy, in alignment with franchise directions, and drive its implementation throughout the entire region, for both Private and Public/Institutional markets. Support & monitor Clusters and Countries in the strategy implementation, to accelerate products launches but also product uptakes & market development, in close collaboration with medical regulatory, public affairs & operations teams Provide to countries the marketing, sales force & commercial excellence orientations and tools to support & drive business growth for the core vaccines. Enhance marketing, business excellence, communication capabilities throughout the region by emphasizing customer focus and achieving best practices sharing and synergies across the region Collaborate with the Global functions to create a dynamic exchange and working environment    Responsibilities   REGION MARKETING STRATEGY & STRATEGIC PLANNING Define, refine and ensure the implementation of vaccine portfolio strategies and objectives in line with regional ambition and needs. The goal being to continually improve market position with consistency and coherency across the product ranges for both Private and Public markets. Ensure proper integration of portfolio strategies through:  Country Strategic Planning exercise Effective Brand Plans within each country Budget & 3 year Financial Forecast exercise  Drive, implement and monitor key Global and Regional strategies/initiatives through strategic input and close collaboration with the countries and across regional functions Build and defend the necessary resources and capabilities at both regional and country level to achieve sales ambition through:  Regional Execution Plan Delivering expertise and training to guide and build capabilities and competencies in the countries  Jointly responsible along with Regional Finance, Regional Business Planning and Region Head in ensuring that the countries [and therefore Region] achieve the Commercial Operations targets in terms of Sales, Margin, OPEX and BOI.   PRODUCT LAUNCH & OPERATİONAL MARKETING ACTIVITIES Support the countries in all aspects of product marketing and accompany them in delivering expected results through:  All the stages of product Life Cycle Management Pre-launch to launch and beyond Developing market strategy and expansion for private and public Developing new channels and initiatives to grow the business and evolve the business model Anticipate changes in the environment and plan accordingly  Provide regional support in the form of: product launch teams, product strategy workshops, marketing and launch excellence, KOs and stakeholder development activities (congress, masterclass organization), market research, regional campaigns, etc. Lead the development and integration of digital marketing across the region by providing expertise and guidance. The digital area includes multichannel marketing and engagement, content, and analytics to monitor spend and effectiveness Support the allocation process in collaboration with Business Operations to optimize sales whilst maintaining product strategy   SALES & MARKETING EXCELLENCE Ensure continuous enhancement of marketing capabilities across the Region in close collaboration with Global Field Excellence / Sales Effectiveness teams, in SP and Sanofi – support Marketing and Launch excellence dissemination across the region Ensure Sales Force optimization  through alignment of SFE standards across the region with the support of Global Field Excellence SP & Sanofi teams (training, curriculum, categorization, sales dashboard, incentives, sales rep monitoring tools, appropriate usage of CRM/ CLM and related dashboard etc) Provide direction in assessing market trends & Improve Analytics usage across the region for decision making process and for seeking short and long-term opportunities Implement a network to generate cross-fertilization and teamwork among clusters and Region, but also ensure close interactions with the other Divisions of the Group into the Region in order to benefit from their own best practices, optimize resources and capture any significant and attractive new business opportunity for Vaccines.   COMMERCIAL EXCELLENCE Improve market value, efficiencies and profitability across the region Develop with Finance and Operations the Pricing & Commercial Policies of the region Optimize volumes & value, resources allocation and product life cycle for Private, Institutional and Public markets Support countries in their private and public markets assessment, development & optimization (including resource allocation, sales-out monitoring, opportunities review etc Lead the improvement of Sales Force effectiveness through implementation of appropriate segmentation, targeting, profiling methods, use of CRM/ CLM tools and related dashboards and country interventions Lead the development of new customers segments and new ways to reach customers, including Public customers, in collaboration with Global Field Excellence  & GDST (MCM, digital and customer centric projects as examples)   PEOPLE DEVELOPMENT & MANAGEMENT Provide clear leadership throughout the Region and direction to the Marketing Teams in clusters & countries Ensure continuous improvement and building of Marketing Competencies in the region Accountable for selecting and retaining marketing team, who meet core competency and job performance criteria Ensure Performance Management for direct and functional teams providing regular feedback and ensuring priority setting, appraisals and performance management cycle. Ensure Talent Management: manage the professional development of marketing teams, prepare succession plans
Job Requirements: Experience & Competency Skills  Bachelor’s degree qualification with Post Grad in Marketing as an added advantage Minimum 10 years’ experience in marketing with proven people management experience      Regional /Global  and /or vaccine market experience is highly desirable and off advantage Excellent communication skills and fluency in English with other local languages being a plus Strong analytical/financial/business skills with strong customer focus and orientation Knowledge with Marketing Effectiveness tools Experience in Portfolio Management with exposure to both public and private market P&L understanding – OPEX and A&P Management Cross-Functional Projects, Cross-fertilization skills  Expert communication skills to lead, influence and impact business strategy and decisions Demonstrated and dynamic leadership within large multifunctional teams Creative and Strategic Thinking, critical to anticipating changes in the environment, planning and solution finding People development and focus to build competencies and capabilities of each individual in the team Drive and ability to build a results-oriented organization.

Job Description: The Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.  In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.  As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.
Job Requirements: ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

Liaise with 3rd party product vendors, Interface Systems, external stake holders for any incidents, issues, license management, etc.   Engage with customer for new requirements gathering, analysis, design, prototype, documentation, and implement solutions iteratively using DevOps, Agile methodologies Manage and guide the project lead, developers, support for any new enhancements works. Maintain knowledge of emerging trends related to analytics, data management, statistical computing / machine learning, business intelligence, data visualization, etc. Manage the development and execution of predictive analytics and machine learning models for a variety of applications

Should hold IT project management certification (CITPM) or equivalent. Experience in implementing large scale IT projects with Government customers. Demonstrated track record of success in delivering advanced analytics capabilities & predictable data project implementations Direct experience in implementing data management processes, procedures, data quality management, and decision support. Knowledge on Cloudera Hadoop, Machine Learning is required. Working knowledge of data mining, statistical analysis and machine learning concepts, with the ability to apply them to make better decisions, find hidden patterns, and predict outcomes Experience managing and working in an agile environment using agile tools and practices (as applied specifically to BI and advanced analytics projects) Experience building out and managing an organization's data capabilities, including staff, tools, and processes is a plus Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills

At least 5 - 8 years of experience building scalable and reliable batch and streaming data pipeline. Strong competency in SQL, python programming, linux shell scripting.  Knowledge of data management, ETL tool/services from Amazon Web Services (e.g. Athena, Glue, Kinesys, Redshift), Google Cloud Platform (e.g. Big Query), BI tools (e.g. Sisense, Tableau) would be an advantage. Job Title: Demand Planning Manager, Animal Health, ROPU SEASK
Company Name: BOEHRINGER INGELHEIM ANIMAL HEALTH SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
Job Description: Description: This position oversees, manages and steers all demand planning activities in the Animal Health business unit across the South East Asia and South Korea (SEASK) region for customers across a range of SKUs and product categories/species and thereby coordinates cross-functional inputs from sales and marketing and other sources to ensure optimized service levels and efficient inventory management. This position is located in the BI Singapore office and reports to the Head of Commercial Supply Chain Management, ROPU SEASK. Duties & Responsibilities:   Manage replenishment planning activities within the Regional Operative Unit (ROPU) by:   Performing net requirement (GRP) planning & coordinate with global suppliers on the timely shipment and delivery of the requirements   Managing  direct link (DL)  response and alert monitor handling   Managing the AH replenishment planning for countries in distributor model     Maintain SKU replenishment master data with the alignment and agreement with local Operative Units (OPUs) (Safety Stock, EOQ, EOC, Demand and Shipment Consolidation, mode of transportation)    Manage the collaborative forecasting and replenishment process to align BI and customer plans on key events   Pro-actively manage the alignment of JDA/APO with global CSCM contacts   Act as Product Life Cycle Management for the ROPU   Facilitate analytics-based OPU portfolio management/rationalization process   Measure key performance indicators to track and evaluate demand planning process   Prepare analysis, reports and statistics related to Demand Planning and forecasting function     Oversee Launch and Change Planning :   Ensure logistics preparation and execution in preparation of launch and change implementation (SLCI workitems)   Coordinate the launch and change  activities with Global and Local OPU  team  to ensure timely launch and change implementation     Pivotal role working within S&OP cycle, facilitating the creation a robust demand forecast at SKU/week level across the operating horizon, by working closely with customer and commercial and supply chain contacts.
Job Requirements: Requirements:   University degree Bachelor or equivalent. MSc / MBA will be an advantage   Certificates (preferred): APICS/CPIM   Proven capability in Demand Planning management in life science industry, Fast Moving Consumer Goods or Animal Health industries mandatory   In-depth understanding of and/or experience in supply chain management and systems; with at least 8 years of work experience in Supply Chain or Commercial function   Experience in Demand Planning function within a manufacturing environment    Experience in logistics and distribution (inbound to last miles distribution) would be beneficial   Strong performance focus and driving a continuous improvement mindset    Proven capability on working in the matrix organization   Excellent analytical capabilities to interpret information and reports   Ability to manage complexity whilst being comfortable with ambiguity   Attention to detail and high level of accuracy   Experience in SAP APO / JDA   Knowledge and use of MS Excel for analytics and mass data processing   Proficient in English and excellent communication skills   Effective negotiator with excellent presentation skills (oral and written)

Individually or collaborate with other team members to develop AI/ML/AA prototypes/Proof-of-Concept/Proof-of-Value to derive actionable insights from data. Domain experience in public safety, defence, transport, education, and healthcare are highly desired. AI/ML/AA experience in smart city, social media, and procurement are also highly desired.  Good knowledge of AI/ML/AA models, software, and tools with the ability to conceptualise and architect the key components of AI/ML/AA projects; and to develop prototypes using statistical software packages such as R/SAS/SPSS. Experience working with very large data sets, including statistical analyses, data visualization, data mining, and data cleansing/transformation and machine learning. Experience in solutions using technologies such as Hadoop/Hive/Hbase/NoSQL and developer skills in Python, Perl, and Java are highly desired.
