You are responsible in the following:  To engage users like clinicians to understand clinical indicators requirements, perform data analysis to monitor the indicators and visualize these data by Tableau Dashboard. Plan, manage and implement health informatics and data analytics projects to draw insights and perform predictive and prescriptive analytics using R and Orange Theory. Provide consultative support in visualizing, preparing and manage a variety of both internal and external clinical and operation data. With knowledge in Health IT data analytics, exposure to SQL and other ETL Tools, you will be required to utilize these tools to process relevant data. Ability to present information in clear and actionable manner with expertise in data analysis and organizational programs. Collaborate effectively with diverse groups to provide advice for analytics related matters.
Job Requirements: Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics. A team player with good interpersonal skills, detail-oriented and flexible to work across different areas within the team. Proficient in the use of MS Excel (advance), Data Visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, IDEAs), SQL and R. Strong analytical skills with an ability to apply business logic to design and implement data mining techniques on large data sets. Possess strong problem solving, critical thinking skills and comfortable to work in an ambiguity environment. Working knowledge of data mining and forecasting/predictive modeling tools and techniques will be preferred. Ability to deliver clear, concise reports and presentations/dashboards and articulate observations and recommendations effectively. Have a proven track record of building strong relationships with stakeholders at various levels. Can-do attitude and ability to work independently.

Job Description: Data Scientist / Programmer for Regional ATM Modernisation Programme Under the Air Traffic Management Research Institute (ATMRI) (http://atmri.ntu.edu.sg/), Nanyang Technological University, you will be part of ‘Regional ATM Modernisation Programme’ team to perform programming and data analytics for the ASEAN air routes and ATM operations in the region.  Primary Duties or Responsibilities Specifically, you will  Undertake research and development related to Air-space management & Data Analytics. Perform programming support for fast time and real-time simulation tools, doing analytics, and building high quality strategic planning system for future for Air Traffic Management (ATM) eco-system for the region. You will provide expertise on mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics of flow management and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of regional ATM system. Conduct stakeholder meetings to solicit input for development of systems. Interact with senior personnel such as project lead and ATC operations specialist on significant technical matters and coordinate with other specialist teams within programme.  Represent the Institute at regional/global ATM platforms, international forum/conferences. Occasional overseas travel may be required.
Job Requirements: PhD/Masters/Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field. At least 3 years’ experience in any aviation-related fast-time simulation environment. Knowledge of tools like SAAM and AirTop will be an added advantage.  Strong programming skills in C++, Python, etc Experience in Data Science (knowledge in Aviation / Air Traffic Management  Good English writing and communication skills  Independent and team player   We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Location: THE HOUSE OF EDEN, 4 ROBINSON ROAD 048543
Job Description: m]PLATFORM | Programmatic Campaign Manager m]PLATFORM is a Data & Tech division of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. We are currently looking for a Manager to join the Programmatic Trading team in Singapore. The Programmatic Trading team at the heart of all mPlatform activity, and is pivotal to the success of each campaign that is executed. You will work closely with all other teams within the GroupM family to drive programmatic planning, execution, analysis and insights etc. We are looking for someone with a positive attitude, enthusiastic and is flexible in embracing changes and new challenges. Reporting of the role This role reports to the Programmatic Director 3 best things about the job:  It’s a great work environment - You will collaborate with a group of diverse and extremely dedicated colleagues who are all passionate about programmatic advertising Opinions and ideas are highly encouraged, and everyone has a voice at mPlatform. Ambition is expected and passion is admired. We are always open to new ways of thinking from everyone, especially those that will contribute to the overall success of mPlatform. Working within a strong culture focused on collaboration, passion & initiative. There is always something new to learn, new challenges to overcome, and new technology to embrace everyday.  Responsibilities of the role:  Handling platforms like DoubleClick Bid Manager, DCM, Trade desk, App nexus etc. Understanding of Programmatic Buying, including DSPs/SSPs, RTB, ad-exchanges, DMPs, audience targeting. Expertise in CPL, CPA, CPC, CPM & App installs. Manage your workflow and responses to ensure agreed deadlines are met, we are obliging with our service level agreements and executing tasks with 100% accuracy. Review the campaign brief and generate programmatic media plan to deliver client objectives Undertake the campaign set up process for all campaigns within your portfolio, troubleshoot any tracking and discrepancy queries, and ensure campaigns are activated with accuracy and following best practice. Monitoring the success of Campaigns through media analytics, KPIs, and dashboards Accountable for the ongoing management of campaign budgets and daily spend levels, and constant monitoring of tracking to performance goals. identify performance trends across accounts and implement appropriate account optimization based on the insights generated. Analyze ongoing results to identify campaign trends and key insights, and provide thoughtful recommendations to ensure we meet and exceed client goals. Demonstrate innovative ideas which support business growth. Demonstrate strong knowledge of the programmatic video eco-system Demonstration of strong fundamentals of Brand Safety, Viewability and Adfarud. Execution of various type of programmatic deal types. Work closely with the line manager to manage accounts across a portfolio of clients, supporting across day-to-day campaign management responsibilities. Build a great working relationship with your team and client team, operating seamlessly together to deliver success for our clients, across the briefing, booking, set up, optimisation and reporting processes.   Measures of success – In three months:  Built strong relationships with the client teams, internal teams and technology suppliers A strong understanding of the client’s brands and products Gain an in depth understanding of the programmatic landscape, be trained on the various mPlatform tools and understand how mPlatform operates Develop relationships and earn trust with your own team and client teams / local market operation teams  In six months:  Mentor, guide and lead your Executive both on day-to-day aspects as well as from a talent development perspective Become a trusted advisor and partner to your agency team Become proactive at suggesting different initiatives to include in the overall strategy Approach Trading from a strategic perspective – and also incorporate Test and learn initiatives and knowledge share with the wider trading team in all aspects of Programmatic Trading  In 12 months:  Developed your knowledge of other online channels and strategies. Develop and identify gaps/processes/tools to improve campaign performance and efficiency Oversee effective and accurate optimisations and delivery of campaigns Become a trusted advisor to your client teams  What your day job looks like:  Ensures accurate planning and implementation of all campaigns in DSP platforms. It is the responsibility of the trading team to proactively request and implement all necessary trafficking and campaign tracking requirements for every campaign to perform as effectively as possible, and to ensure that we have the tools in place to provide accurate and detailed campaign reporting and feedback as appropriate. Responsible for proactively analyzing delivery data across the channels to identify optimisation opportunities to deliver client objectives.  The focus of the team is to first identify optimisation levers (audience, supply source, temporal, frequency, target, geo, creative copy etc.), understand what the consequence of those optimisation levers are, and having expertise in pulling those levers. Regular WIP meetings and share the campaign performance Providing regular campaign reports to client teams along with insights to influence planning & buying decisions Responding to ad-hoc campaign feedback requests   What you’ll bring:  Deep understanding of DSPs/SSPs, RTB, ad exchanges, DMPs, audience targeting Solid experience of trading within DoubleClick Bid Manager, Trade Desk, Appnexus etc. (any of the DSP) Understanding of the digital media ecosystem and technology including ad tagging and site analytics etc Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment - harvest vast amounts of information, news, data, and research and distil the most important/relevant information for your agency team and their clients Be organised and have a high attention to detail Demonstrate financial and numerical astuteness Evidence of data-driven decision making and analysis Solution-focused -  evidence of working through to a solution in a logical way Demonstrable problem-solving skills Organised and structured Critical analysis of all data ensuring informed buying decisions Attention to detail with high levels of accuracy Innovative ideas which support business growth Strong knowledge of the programmatic display & video eco-system Strong fundamentals of Brand Safety, Viewability and Adfarud. Execution of various type of programmatic deal types.  About mPlatform [m]PLATFORM is an advanced technology suite of flexible media planning applications, data analytics and digital services. The platform will improve advertisers’ ability to use audience defining insights from hundreds of data sources to find and communicate with their consumers across all media. [m]PLATFORM makes it possible for media planners at GroupM agencies to use the most detailed consumer data to achieve results for their clients. It is supported by a team of data scientists, technologists and digital practitioners from across GroupM specialist companies and Xaxis. [m]PLATFORM unifies data analytics and digital services including search, social, mobile, digital ad operations and programmatic into one team delivering a completely open and fully transparent data and technology architecture.  For more information, visit https://www.groupm.com/tags/mplatform About Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients and media owners. As the largest media investment management company in Singapore with over 41% market share (Recma) and over 650 employees, GroupM Singapore is the premiere organisation to join and develop a career in.
Job Requirements: Minimum qualifications:  3+ years professional experience with digital media preferably within a media agency/publisher trading desk Hands on experience and knowledge in programmatic optimisation Experience in campaign implementation, optimization and reporting, experience with performance campaigns Experience in DBM Competent in all Microsoft office software

Job Description: What You'll Do As a Data Scientist, you will:   • Be the Problem-solver and be the catalyst that will help business teams make better decisions using Data and Analytics • Bring to the table an inter-disciplinary skillset of Applied Math, Technology and Business • Develop Data Products/Services across Descriptive, Inquisitive and Prediictive Analytics to improve business processes and drive tangible business outcomes • Design, build, and operationalize models using the latest in AI/ML techniques to build relevant solutions • Lead complex analytics programs, working with cross-functional teams • Coach and mentor other Data Scientists  • Above all, come with a curious mind and a passionate learning mindset Who You'll Work With Join us at Data and Analytics : we are building a world-class team of passionate, result oriented problem solvers with the aim of enabling better data-driven decisions and thereby creating business impact.  We operate as a startup: work hard, learn every day, focus on doing measurable and impactful work; and have lots of fun along the way
Job Requirements: Who You Are • Thrive in a multi-tasking, rapid prototyping, and agile development environment Our minimum requirements for this role:  • BS in math, statistics, data science, computer science, engineering, or economics • Minimum 8-10 years related analytics/data science experience • 2+ years experience in a data scientist role doing machine learning, predictive models, artificial intelligence, deep learning, preferably with some of that at a B2B company • Experience with data warehousing and data Integration  tools • Experience with Teradata, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, SAP HANA • Advanced or expert level in SQL, R, Python • Experience with visualization tools, e.g. Tableau or Qlik • Strong communication skills • Ability to draw conclusions from data and recommend actions

Job Description: Job description Singtel Group Consumer has created an exciting new opportunity for a Data Scientist, who is passionate in delivering impact through analytics. The successful candidate will design and build analytics solutions and products to deliver superior business outcomes, across all aspects of the business. Exceptional candidates will also show an analytical curiosity, going beyond the immediate requirements of the project to find deep insights that others have missed.   Responsibilities  Identify and plan analytics use cases with business owners Apply cutting edge analytics to generate new business insights across all business functions Develop and deploy analytical solutions across a variety of business functions, including, but not limited to: customer acquisition, customer retention, product development, pricing decisions, network roll-out Track and improve performance of analytical solutions developed Communicate findings to wider audiences within Singtel Stay current on cutting edge business applications, tools and approaches
Job Requirements: Required Skills and Qualifications  Significant relevant experience building and deploying advanced analytics solutions in telco, cable or B2C environment. Relevant topics include: customer acquisition, customer segmentation and targeting, customer LTV maximization, churn prevention, cost modeling of transportation & logistics operations, predictive maintenance Advanced degree preferred: Masters degree with 3-5 years experience in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or a related quantitative field. Deep technical and data science expertise, including experience in the following: 	 Analytical methods: statistical modeling (e.g., linear regression, GLMs, time series), supervised machine learning (e.g., random forests, neural networks), design of experiments, segmentation/clustering, text mining, network analysis (e.g., location allocation), optimization, simulation Analytics tools: Data wrangling (SQL, R, Python, PostGRESql, Spark, Hadoop/Hive), Data Modeling (R, Python, SAS, RapidMiner, SPSS), Data visualization (Tableau, Microstrategy)   Experience building in-production models, including associated scripting, error handling and documentation Strong record of professional accomplishment Highly logical  & systematic, team player & fast learner

Job Description: Design, develop and improve enterprise systems, real time information system, web applications or software for data management, data processing, data analytics and data visualization, using assigned languages, frameworks/libraries and coding conventions Design data modelling, data processing and analytics workflow to mine information across systems Work with project managers and operational managers to deliver enterprise systems that meet user requirements Conduct technology scan and proof-of-concept on data management, data processing and data analytics technologies Manage enterprise system performance, inter-operability, reliability and sustainability through software development, software quality control and optimization of software products and technologies Resolve system issues to provide timely resolution and recovery
Job Requirements: Candidates with at least 5 years of experience in Fintech software development and/or system integration will be considered for senior positions;  Proficient with one the programming languages such as C, C++, C#, .NET, WPF or Python;  Strong knowledge in Payment System and E-wallet design principles and familiar with UML;  Possess a good understanding of multi-threading programming, performance bottlenecks, databases and networking Applicants who possess relevant experience for the above responsibilities are most welcome to apply.

Job Description: An IT Business Solutions Manager plans, directs and coordinates the acquisition, development, maintenance and use of computer and telecommunication systems, and manpower required. These include implementing and managing logistics IT business solutions for customers. The resourceful and analytical individual is expected lead a department and make business decisions independently. Design, develop and improve enterprise systems, real time information system, web applications or software for data management, data processing, data analytics and data visualization, using assigned languages, frameworks/libraries and coding conventions Design data modelling, data processing and analytics workflow to mine information across systems Work with project managers and operational managers to deliver enterprise systems that meet user requirements Conduct technology scan and proof-of-concept on data management, data processing and data analytics technologies Manage enterprise system performance, inter-operability, reliability and sustainability through software development, software quality control and optimization of software products and technologies Resolve system issues to provide timely resolution and recovery Additional Information:Degree in Information System, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent;
Job Requirements: ~ Align organisational IT strategy with customer experience strategy. ~ Align resources management (manpower and asset) strategy with business strategy across different business activities. ~ Determine key messages to communicate to internal stakeholders for application of latest technology trends. ~ Develop measures to improve vendor management capability in the organisation. ~ Develop new business enabled by IT. ~ Develop strategic project plan to align projects with business strategy. ~ Drive the successful completion of technology projects. ~ Facilitate interactions between internal and external partners to design and implement technology projects. ~ Influence customers to identify new business that can be enabled by IT. ~ Influence key account managers to identify new business and grow relationships that assists in revenue generation in multiple verticals. ~ Influence key accounts' needs to maximise IT solutioning revenue generation. ~ Influence stakeholders perspectives of requirements and activities. ~ Integrate new enabled IT process and systems across functions. ~ Lead team/ departmental projects. ~ Manage integrated IT solutions through cost-benefits analysis to serve complex customer needs. ~ Manage network security of IT enabled processes and systems. ~ Review allocation of resources across different business activities. ~ Review customers' IT enterprise architecture to further improve system integration. ~ Review different aspects of project management based on priorities and needs. ~ Review projects to meet cost and benefit targets of a programme. Candidates with at least 5 years of experience in Fintech software development and/or system integration will be considered for senior positions;  Proficient with one the programming languages such as C, C++, C#, .NET, WPF or Python;  Strong knowledge in OO design principles and familiar with UML;  Possess a good understanding of multi-threading programming, performance bottlenecks, databases and networking Applicants who possess relevant experience for the above responsibilities are most welcome to apply.

Job Description: Team: Enterprise Services Operations team Location: Singapore   Microsoft Services mission is to lead and serve our customers and partners as they realize their full potential in a mobile-first, cloud-first world. We are a diverse group of technical architects, engineers, consultants and support professionals, more than 21,000 strong, serving customers in 191 countries and 46 languages. We drive over $5B in revenue annually.    Services continues to be the key differentiator in accelerating a customer transformation ensuring they get the most out of their technology investments. In order to support Microsoft’s transformation, we must continue to evolve what we sell, how we sell, how we deliver, how we operate, and how we drive consumption for the company.   Enterprise Services (ES) worldwide delivery organization focused on Global Domain Delivery. This new delivery model was designed to better align Delivery resources and support end-to-end offerings for our customers. Global Domains are aligned by technology and include a broad set of global expertise to create an agile delivery team that supports the customer lifecycle from pre-sales, to implementation, to proactive services.    Responsibilities     The ES Operations team which is part Planning and Business Excellence organization has a mandate to partner with Domain and Account aligned delivery Leadership to achieve Operational Excellence. As a part of this endeavor we have an opening for a seasoned Planning & Insights leader to partner with the Enterprise Services Leaders.  Deliver robust annual/ quarterly delivery planning (demand and capacity plans) for both Consulting and Premier business by providing key insights / inputs from Areas / Time zones to central planning & domain facing planning team and vice versa. Collaborate with diverse set of stakeholders in Areas, Multi-sub areas, subsidiaries on delivery planning syndicate with Finance and GCM counterparts and ensure an integrated plan is built between Areas and domains on demand and capacity for ES business Support clarity across area and domains on planning inputs/outputs and connected processes / RACIs Provide leadership in enabling the below challenges to represent before appropriate forums / decision makers for resolution and circle back to the respective stakeholders     Accuracy and Feasibility of Domain & Area Interlock Capacity distribution across Multi Sub Area & Sales Locations Area specific capacity around Language, Pub-Sec, Security Cleared Balance area needs and specifics with affordability and all up plan Monitor and revise Area /Sub level Resource and PPG Mix Sold Margin vs. Delivery Margin at Area Level Respond and clarify Area concerns on Demand & Capacity Drive Premier One Plan Process in Areas Provide insights from Areas on PNEH, Burn rate, service mix, technology mix relating to premier delivery Area Presales Planning & maintenance Area pivot for CFO Forecasting Support monthly & adhoc capacity analytics requirements (TZ, Area & Sales Location) level Deliver capacity insights for Area xBUs     Provide forward looking business visibility based on advanced statistical analytics, predictive models and deep insights (Scenario modelling, Trend Analysis, Correlations/ Knowledge Discovery, Machine Learning, Statistical Forecasting, Early Warning System etc.). Ability to handle large, complex and disparate data sets; build models ground up, interpret the story behind the numbers and syndicate the output with broader set of stakeholders. Identify trends and inconsistencies in data to provide perspective and business solutions. Present data-driven analyses to solve complex business problems. Provide analytics and insights to the business leaders to have consequential business review rhythms (QBR/ MBR) by closely monitoring the Key Performance Indicators, Critical Success Factors, Scorecard Metric, Cost and Productivity levers, Sales Motion, Leading/ Lagging Indicators, Red Pockets, Root Cause Analyses, Recovery Plans, Investments/ ROIs. Enable the business leaders on Governance, Control and Compliance aspects.  Key Success Criteria and Competencies required   Future orientation balanced with current state through strategic and systems thinking and a global mindset Influencing stakeholders to achieve impact through collaboration, presence and strong communication skills Judgment based Scoping of problems by identifying key issues, inputs, stakeholders, and outcomes. Applies a broad functional knowledge base to solve problems with confidence and persuades others Dealing with Ambiguity Change Management Analytical problem solving​
Job Requirements: Qualifications   Experience and Qualification include:   Ideal candidates should have 15+ years of experience in areas related to Planning, Analytics, Finance, Operations, services delivery etc., and should be self-motivated, confident in working with Senior Leaders and comfortable working in a matrix organization. The candidate need to be able to achieve results through influence across multiple organizations.    Bachelors in business, information technology, Finance , Operations or related field, and/or equivalent experience Proven stakeholder management skills, especially in a cross organizational matrixed teams A strong business aptitude coupled with an affinity or appreciation for technology and the advancement of technology in thriving organizations Ability to effectively prioritize and coordinate multiple work streams of activities Knowledge and understanding of the financial and operational functions of a delivery organization (i.e., budget, time logging, optimizing cost, escalation processes, invoicing, capacity management) Ability to develop strong, productive relationships with colleagues and management to meet targeted objectives An analytical mindset with the ability define metrics, reports, interpret results, and make recommendations on appropriate courses of action Excellent communication, collaboration, organizational, time management, presentation, and writing skills Proactive, self-motivated, and team-oriented with strong capabilities to lead and thrive in start-up type organizations​    Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.   Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Job Description: Lead regular financial planning update in line with ESP vision & One SEA governance model:  Develop key business analytics to support resource allocation between country / portfolios, benchmarking with external market, internal across region/country. Support target setting for One SEA countries and give guidance to business / countries. Budget transfer tracking/communication across sectors / countries. Review and align with COE about One SEA planning calendars & processes, support COE for further alignment with sector regional offices and corporate group controller on One SEA planning process. Design country planning review deck. Guide COE colleagues in templets development and consolidation requirements. Collaborate with sector regional offices and corporate group controller on One SEA planning process. Regular planning review deck preparation for GOC review.    Lead ONE SEA Long Range Financial Plan (LRFP) process with One SEA strategy plan team, based on One SEA requirements and consider sector requirements & submission dates:  Prepare One SEA LRFP calendars & processes  Design work templets and review deck LRFP consolidation and submission to each sector Coordinate LRFP ONE SEA LT review LRFP review deck preparation for GOC review     Manage One SEA total budget to deliver as per target:  Proactively manage One SEA financial budgets to ensure One SEA meet its quarterly and FY financial commitments. Develop key finance analytics and management reporting to support and drive performance management & support key business decision making    Business partnering with One SEA regional functions:  Responsible for One SEA regional function budgeting and lead business partnering with regional functional leaders with the support of COE and LGS. Provide productive monthly report with financial insights. Regular communication with regional functional leaders, deep dive for the variance, find the root cause and timely seek for the further action plan.    ONE SEA level project support & provide finance leadership of cluster level initiatives:  Primary contact person for corporate/regional special project request.  Coordinate projects’ process/consolidation with ONE SEA BUFs in each market. Provide ONE SEA level project base analysis and support.     Other responsibilities:  Representing One SEA BUF on One SEA planning system development & deployment Deck preparation for ONE SEA level Financial reviews
Job Requirements: Minimum 8 years working experiences within FP&A or business partnering MBA / CPA is preferred The ability to accept and manage ambiguity and change. Strong framing and analytical skills are required. Advanced Excel, PowerPoint and data management skills are required.   The ability to manage and prioritize multiple requirements is required.  Strong project management skills are preferred The ability to work on multiple projects with conflicting deadlines is required The ability to design business processes and have the ability to work effectively in a new, dynamic, and fast paced environment is required. Strong communication, presentation and collaboration skills A self-starter with strong influential skills and the ability to prioritize and deliver in complex environment and multiple stakeholders.

Job Description: The Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.  In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.  As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.
Job Requirements: ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

Job Title: Assistant Finance Manager, Performance Management & Reporting
Job Location: MAPLETREE BUSINESS CITY, 20 PASIR PANJANG ROAD 117439
Job Description: ABOUT UNILEVER INTERNATIONAL: Unilever International (UI) is an alternative but complimentary route to market, servicing white space opportunities not exploited by local operating countries.  It is a global business unit with 9 hubs (Singapore, US, UK, Korea, India, Dubai, France, the Philippines and Australia) with a diverse range of products, with expertise in utilizing 3rd party distributors and consolidators to reach consumers in over 75 countries. UI have been operating successfully as an alternate Route to Market (RtM) to complement Multi-Country Organizations (MCOs) to serve these white spaces through a network of 500+ market expansion service providers and specialists via seeding initiatives. The market expansion providers or distributors in countries provide brand building and customer development services to UI under the agreed operating frameworks using the brand toolkits provided. UI have strategically evolved its portfolio from availability led growth to seeding in the last 5 years.  JOB TITLE: Assistant Finance Manager, Performance Management & Reporting JOB LOCATION: Singapore RELOCATION TERMS: Local terms  MAIN PURPOSE OF THE JOB: This role will also be involved in performance management and reporting. There will be an emphasis upon information management, process simplification and automation where possible, allowing way of workings driven commonly with faster speed among all the hubs.  The role needs to actively coordinate with the appropriate Unilever stakeholders to ensure a globally harmonized management reporting process for UI.  MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES: Performance Management and Reporting  Develop close working relationships with senior stakeholders globally to ensure alignment of monthly forecast for various business units (BU) within UI and ensuring accurate delivery of monthly financial forecast; Be the contact point for UI to help interface with global finance on reporting of results, ensuring timely and accurate submissions; Set up reporting units to enable seamless data flow through transactional system (ERP), data warehouse and Unilever reporting system; Assists with information management, process simplification and automation; Initiates continuous improvement for efficiently reporting purpose.  Analytics  Support the development of various performance measures targets; Analysis, insight and control over targets and actual performance measures; Assist in the work on strengthening of process for Information Analytics.  Others   Any other ad-hoc tasks required by the business.
Job Requirements: RELEVANT SKILL/ EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Experience & Personal Characteristics Responsible for both financial analysis and business performance, the candidate must possess both strong quantitative abilities and excellent written and oral communication skills. They are strategic, analytical thinkers who are driven by results and can innovate and develop creative financial solutions. The candidate must have the necessary accounting qualifications (CPA/ACCA and/or past exposure to financial audit role is preferred) and is expected to have 5 years+ of holistic experience in different aspects of Finance and Accounting; Performance Management. Passion to learn and make a difference.  The candidate has high levels of self-assurance and shows resilience and belief in own ability to achieve goals. The individual will need to be a relationship builder and able to get things done independently. Must have a high level of integrity supported by strong interpersonal skills, good maturity and ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organization will be critical to the success of this role.  Lastly being part of the UI family, the candidate must be able to thrive in a fast paced and highly dynamic environment and navigate through complexities to arrive at solutions. He/she is expected to demonstrate the following leadership behaviors:  Strategic, Systemic Thinking & Entrepreneurial High Growth mind-set & Consumer/Shopper and Customer focus UL SOLs: Building talent and teams, Bias for action and change, Accountability and responsibility  Strong Communication & Influencing skills  Critical Competencies  Working knowledge of SAP or other similar accounting software systems Experience dealing with multiple currencies and exchange rates preferred Strong analytical and writing skills Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office software Ability to build effective working relationships and communicate at all levels within the organization    TO APPLY:  Please apply online by clicking on “Apply Online” below. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements. Should you not meet our immediate requirements, your profile will be registered in our talent pool system and we will match your profile to suitable future vacancies.  You will be able to access your status update through the candidate tracking link.  Thank you for your interest and application.  *We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified. Want to join our Talent Community? Please register your details here: http://unilever.avature.net/madebyyou?tags=singtc

Job Title: Digital API & Agile Transformation Consultants - Senior Associate / Manager, Advisory
Job Description: We are a team of creative and inspiring designers, developers, and strategic thinkers that partner with our deep analytics team, customer journey design team to focus on the business and employee experience implications of digital-first for our clients.   About the opportunity Digital API & Agile Transformation Consultants at EY Digital are the engine room of our business, working on the front lines with our client, colleagues and third-parties to execute the digital business vision. We work across industries and markets, cross-pollinating the best of digital, customer, strategy and technology to help our clients monetize data and design new services through API solutions, and help execute digital transformation through large scale agile methodologies and modern agile development platforms. And at the heart of it all, embed customer centric experience design in how we execute. Digital API & Agile Transformation Consultants embrace an achievement focused culture within EY, living EY’s core values, and positively influencing our culture more widely through the collaborative engagement of other internal teams to deliver leading practice digital strategy, innovation, customer experiences and digital operations.   Key Responsibilities:  Feel excited working with multiple parts of the businesses across multiple industries, solutioning and delivering complex digital solutions You find yourself always wanting to innovate and shape the industry, wanting to differentiate You have been known to be able to understand both sides of a coin, the business aspect and the technology aspect of things You believe that Design Thinking and is the way to go in everything that we do, and Agile Methodologies can be applied appropriately in how we execute
Job Requirements: Skills and Attributes for success  You always see yourself as someone who likes being near the businesses and is always passionate about looking for opportunities in turning day to day business challenges into digital solutions You enjoy communicating with people from various background and skill sets across an organisation, and has always been great at communicating an idea or POV across various channels and mediums    To qualify for the role, you must have:  Minimum of three years' experience as an internal or external consultant working on business transformation, product, operations and/or technology projects in a digital environment Experience of multi-channel digital environments having worked in professional services and/or customer focused companies Skilled in all aspects of Design Thinking including user research, functional requirements definition, business process analysis, business modelling, and workshop design and facilitation, or working knowledge of the full lifecycle of software development using Agile Methodologies Either strong Business Analysis experience or deep Technical expertise combined with strong knowledge of one or more of Digital/Ecommerce/Government/Financial Services/Consumer Products Detailed knowledge of creating user stories/requirements definition/acceptance criteria using agile tools and techniques Deep understanding of either API, Low Code Development platform, Chatbots or CRM B2B and B2C exposure      Ideally, you’ll also have  Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills Ability to work in a collaborative and client-facing environment Experience of working with or as part of a scrum team Advanced degrees relevant to digital delivery.    What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   What working at EY offers  EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:    Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you      About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

Job Description: Our EY Digital and Emerging Technology Practice is a team of creative and inspiring developers, designers and strategic thinkers that partner with our analytics, customer experience and functional advisory teams to generate real business outcomes for our clients through digital transformation.   About the opportunity   Recruits at EY Digital are the engine room of our business, working on the front lines with our client, colleagues and third-parties to transform businesses. They work across industries and markets, cross-pollenating the best of digital, customer, strategy and technology to design, build and run the businesses of tomorrow. They traverse the digital spectrum from strategy and innovation, through to experience transformation and digitization of operations. No two days are the same.   We are currently looking to hire Experienced Senior Managers and Directors to lead our growing Emerging Technology team. This team will help build and take to market our solutions across a range of technologies, including Robotic Process Automation, Machine Learning / AI and Blockchain. The Emerging Technology team works closely with EY’s functional experts in Finance, IT, HR, Supply Chain, Customer and Strategy, as well as with our sector teams across various industries, to design, develop and implement fit-for-purpose solutions for our clients.   Key Responsibilities:  Engage with a range of clients, designing solutions which will deliver real business value, enabled by a broad range of emerging technologies and developing digital strategies for our clients Collaborate effectively across multiple parts of the EY and client businesses to deliver complex digital solutions and strategies Develop proposals and prototypes to help our clients understand how these solutions will be delivered and what impact they will have on their business Create thought leadership, demonstrations and other materials that articulate our point of view on emerging technologies to both clients and EY colleagues Build our business by enabling our sector / functional teams, developing tools and creating methodologies for the practical application of emerging technologies to address real business issues
Job Requirements: Skills and Attributes for success  You have a passion for emerging technology and you enjoy building things You are like being near the business and get satisfaction from delivering tangible outcomes You enjoy communicating with people from various backgrounds and can simplify complex technical conversations to help your audience understand the key concepts and the value that will be delivered You have a desire to build a business in an area of strategic importance to EY and to our clients      To qualify for the role, you must have:  Minimum of ten years' experience as an internal or external consultant working on business transformation, product, operations and/or technology projects in a digital environment A background in programming and / or data science. Specific knowledge of one or more of the follow technologies is a plus: Robotic Process Automation, Machine Learning / AI, Blockchain, IOT, Chatbots, VR/AR/MR. A track record in leveraging design thinking, functional requirements definition, business process analysis, business modelling, and workshop design and facilitation to assess business issues and develop solutions Working knowledge of the full lifecycle of software development and the broad emerging technology ecosystem Proven leadership qualities A demonstrable experience of designing and implementing emerging technology solutions with clients to deliver real business value Experience of working with or as part of a scrum team and delivering projects using Agile    Ideally, you’ll also have  Advanced degree relevant to digital delivery in emerging technology    What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   What working at EY offers  EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Job Title: Senior Manager  /  Manager, Group Chief Operations Office
Company Name: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.

Job Description: Moving material makes the world’s work possible. Caterpillar customers and their equipment are hard at work in every corner of the globe, and they can’t afford to slow down or stop. They need our machines, engines and parts to do the world’s work. That’s what our logistics team makes possible—using the latest digital, analytics and data forecasting tools to move material where it needs to be, when it needs to be there. Want to join this process-driven, results-oriented group? The Product Support & Logistics Division currently has an opening for a Supply Chain Planning Engineer located at our Singapore Distribution Centre.   Working as a Supply Chain Planning Engineer for the Facility Health organisation on the Cat Logistics team, you are responsible for facility performance levels to corporate targets for inventory storage utilization, improving storage efficiency, improving facility operational results and managing capital improvement projects. You will lead facility efforts to implement process improvements and standard compliance where realised benefits are evident.  Job Duties/Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:  Working independently as well as working effectively with diverse, multi-functional teams Gathering and analysing data on facility demand and demand variability Gathering and analysing data about inbound and outbound functions throughout the facility Managing the facility rearrangement plan and rearrangement team to complete planned rearrangement activities, including capacity and productivity goals Completing capital purchasing functions for the facility, including procurement, installation and place-into-service Maintain facility product slotting rules to align with inventory profile changes over time Look for continuous improvement opportunities throughout the entire facility and make expert recommendations for process changes to improve results Lead and/or participate on cross-functional teams targeting facility improvements Collaborate with engineers globally to benchmark best practices and implement improvements Working with WMS to optimise setup for local business conditions
Job Requirements: Basic Qualifications and eligibility:  Bachelor Degree qualified or possess the relevant work experience Thorough experience in one of the following functional areas: Supply Chain, Manufacturing / Operations, Manufacturing Engineering, Inventory Management, 6 Sigma/Cat Production System Experience with Warehouse Operations and Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) Prior experience with MS Office & data analysis   Top Candidates Will Also Possess:  Bachelor level degree, preferably in Mechanical or Industrial Engineering or business Previous experience in Logistics Planning & Engineering or as a Supply Chain Planning Analyst or Supply Chain Engineer Understanding of Industrial Engineering Principles Strong problem solving, analytical, priority setting and communication skills SAP EWM Warehouse Management experience Prior experience using AutoCAD

Job Industry: General Management, Marketing / Public Relations , Sales / Retail
Job Description: This position is leading the regional lead for Net Revenue Management in AMEA region, ensure consistent application of the global playbooks, driving results, standardization and simplification across Net Revenue Management (NRM) building capability on category growth stories, optimizing our Trade Spend investment and ensuring the correct systems and analytics in place to best deliver this. Also will help drive the new AMEA Operating model to ensure compliance and adherence to AMEA Sales Protocols, collaborate with market Category Planning & Activation (CP&A) leads to enable greater speed, accelerate growth and build best in class CP&A capabilities across AMEA; This role is also to ensure smooth communication and alignment with global Net Revenue Management Sales lead, but also to leverage the rest of the AMEA regional Sales to unlock the growth agenda across AMEA.    Some of the key accountabilities for this role will include (but are not limited to)  Drive CP&A capability across the region based on the global NRM 6 pillar approach Contract with over 2,000 distributors, country distributors and direct buying wholesalers and coverage at over 2MM outlets Manage effectively and efficiently over $1.7bn trade spending per year to drive our NRM optimization targets for the AMEA region Drive the Global Centre of Excellence (COE) NRM 6 pillar approach to enhance commercial planning and bring more strategic planning between BU/Market/Growth team; Ensure compliance to the new AMEA operating model in AMEA and ensure as the owner of the Sales protocols that all markets adhere to the new way of working 	 Work with IT to ensure we have the best NRM tools to ensure best management of Trade Spend, strategic Customer Partnership and Joint Business Planning (JBPs) Key contact for AMEA Supply Chain leadership team to ensure support delivering Order to Cash/Overdue and Regional Sales Returns policy  Work closely with Shopper Insights and Consumer insights to ensure we bring the Category Growth Story (CGS) work to life and compliments the demand spaces work across the region
Job Requirements: Broad knowledge of Sales business processes (“credible counterpart for local Sales community”) General management experience with Profit & Loss (P&L) responsibility Category Planning & Activation with strong commercial acumen   Front line sales experience Well respected leader, who can mobilize the organisation

Job Industry: Advertising / Media , Marketing / Public Relations , Purchasing / Merchandising, Sales / Retail
Job Description: About Supernova We are the fastest growing health & beauty social e-commerce company. We build health and beauty products for a new generation of women worldwide. Independently owned with a global marketing reach and offices in London, LA, Singapore, New Delhi and Melbourne, we connect with over 12 million women on social media every week. Our brands include Sand & Sky, BodyBoss, SkinnyMint and Coco & Eve. About the Job To drive worldwide growth for all of our e-commerce brands in the fitness, beauty, and health & wellness categories. The Business Development and Growth Director will be responsible for building and driving customer growth for all brands in Supernova. You will drive new customer acquisition strategies, manage new market entries, manage our retail portfolio  and play a pivotal role advising the Board of Directors on future business development opportunities. You will have a strong background in performance marketing, media buying and proven experience managing growth of ecommerce brands. This position will involve collaboration with leaders of each brand and channel to identify new customer programs, business opportunities, and strategic relationships that will profitably drive sales growth while upholding the brands image. The ideal candidate will have 10 + years experience setting strategy for an ecommerce or multi-channel retail business, with an ability to leverage customer behavior to drive results. This candidate must have experience in managing an ecommerce-focused marketing team and have well-rounded marketing expertise. Established success in ecommerce marketing and experience in driving the following programs is required: multi-channel strategy, email marketing, paid search placement, search engine optimization, affiliate marketing, direct response, marketing analytics, digital advertising, and CRM. Responsibilities:  Identify opportunities that will profitably grow the business and generate incremental revenue while enhancing our brands Develop a global customer acquisition strategy that aligns to the business strategy Lead direct marketing acquisition, retention, and reactivation strategies and programs with the goal of driving revenue and cultivating long-term customer relationships Identify and build strategic partnerships that will profitability drive sales growth Manage the global offline and online retail strategy Manage the global strategy for Marketplaces including Amazon Develop and share metrics and insights with the Board Represent customers’ perspective and serve as their advocate Provide innovation and creative thought leadership to all marketing programs Mentor and coach an international, cross office teams of acquisition, affiliate marketing,  CRM and Loyalty, Area-, Retail and Marketplace Managers
Job Requirements: Your Profile:  10+ years of developing and executing successful online marketing programs High-growth, early-stage marketing experience with a proven track record of scaling up Proven ability to live by metrics that drive success, measure KPI's, socialize understanding, and drive initiative to completion Excellent communication (written, verbal & presentation) skills Highly analytical and data driven Experience managing third party providers Proficiency in funnel and cohort analytics to inform future strategies  In return you will get:  Flat hierarchy and co-operative working atmosphere Freedom to execute own ideas Competitive package, including share program Gym Membership Full medical cover  This position is available immediately. All applications will be treated confidentially.

Job Description: Established in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and strong tradition in research. To support teaching and cutting-edge research, EEE is host to 11 research centres and more than 50 laboratories, which are well-equipped with modern facilities and state-of-the-art equipment. With about 200 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,300 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world. Our research team is working on Artificial Intelligence, Machine learning, Deep Learning, Extreme Learning Machines, Vehicle Detection, Car Plate Recognition, Lane Recognition, Traffic Sign Recognition. We have the following job opening available:   Research Associate      Requirements:  Master Degree in a relevant discipline, eg: Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, etc. Relevant experience in video analytics. Familiar with popular machine learning techniques, especially Deep Learning, Extreme Learning Machines (ELM). Good track record in machine learning research and development. Good academic record. Able to work independently. Able to communicate and write effectively. Good in MATLAB, Python, C/C++, etc    Application Procedure: Interested candidates please send your CV/resume to:  Prof Huang Guangbin School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering Nanyang Technological University  50 Nanyang Avenue Block S2.1 Singapore 639798 E-mail Address for E-mailed Applications: egbhuang@ntu.edu.sg   Electronic submission of application is highly encouraged.   Only shortlisted candidates will be notified for interview.
Job Requirements: Research Associate       Requirements:  Master Degree in a relevant discipline, eg: Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, etc. Relevant experience in video analytics. Familiar with popular machine learning techniques, especially Deep Learning, Extreme Learning Machines (ELM). Good track record in machine learning research and development. Good academic record.  Able to work independently.  Able to communicate and write effectively. Good in MATLAB, Python, C/C++, etc

Job Title: Senior Manager (Incident Response and Threat Management)
Job Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) aspires to be a world-class organisation in delivering safety and security for our people. In pursuing our mission to make Singapore our Safe and Secure Best Home, we remain always constant and true to our core values of Honour and Unity. The job holder will investigate into cyber security events / incidents within MHA networks and at the same time he/she is solely responsible to establish cyber threat management (post deployment) framework, policies and procedures in MSOC. He/she is responsible for the following: Incident Response  Take charge of incidents or suspected incidents assigned by the Ops cluster and work towards establishing the confidentiality, integrity and availability (CIA Triangle) of information systems and data in MHA. Take lead in responding to incidents / threats in co-ordination with Home Team Department Security Incident Response Officers (SIROs). Collaborate with other cyber incident response agencies such as National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC), Government IT Security Incident Response (GITSIR) & Cyber-Watch Centre (CWC) so that there is proper coordination in reporting to internal and external stakeholders. Work with other IR members to review and update Security Incident Response Plan (SIRP) and response framework in MHA.  Threat Management  Develop assets protection and threat risk scoring program, charter, roadmap, and develop a governance programme for MHA. Compile the following information for internal use:   Indicators of compromise (IOC) Repository of cyber threat intelligence (both generic threats and threats that are directly relevant to MHA Infocomm Technology (ICT) environment)   Fusion of locally derived and externally sourced cyber threat intelligence into signatures, techniques, and analytics intended to detect and track the Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs). Active participation in cyber intelligence threat-sharing groups, typically composed of other Security Operation Centres (SOC) in both government and private sectors.  Job Requirements:  Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or IT equivalent education and experience, preferably with advanced technical credentials. At least 8 years’ work experience in cyber-security and threat Intelligence related area preferably in large mission critical environment (e.g. Critical infrastructure systems), with 2 years in team management. At least 4 years’ working experience in Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT) or cyber incident response management. Certifications in CISSP, GCIH or GSEC are preferred. Government Home Team Ops knowledge and good understanding of their systems & networks are preferred. Strong experience analysing raw log files (i.e. firewall, IDS, PCAP, system logs), perform data correlation, security testing and penetration testing. Experience in troubleshooting and configuring networking devices, application platform, databases, Windows and UNIX system administration. Strong effective communications skills. Good time management and organizational skills. Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills. A team player with the ability to work autonomously.  All new appointees will be appointed on a two-year contract in the first instance. We wish to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified within 30 days upon closing of the advertisement.
Job Requirements: None

Job Description: About the Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) The Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singapore’s largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. For more information about I2R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg Successful candidate will apply machine learning algorithms to develop an evaluation framework that will support a conversational A1 spoken dialogue system for studentsto assess how well they can speak a foreign language. Successful candidate will also develop solid engineering skills in deploying application systems and applied research experience of processing low-resource spoken languages, using techniques such as deep learning, transfer learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, domain and speaker adaptation, and GANs.
Job Requirements: Minimum Bachelor in Engineering Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning with solid R&D experience or knowhow  Proficient in Python/Matlab/C++ programming   Knowledge in Deep Learning   The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified

Company Name: HEWLETT PACKARD ENTERPRISE SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
Job Description: At HPE, we bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions and advance the way people live and work. Our legacy inspires us as we forge ahead dedicated to helping our customers make their mark on the world.   Aruba is redefining the “IT EDGE”. Creating new customer experiences by building intelligent spaces and digital workspaces. We are focused on campus, branch, mobility and the IoT to transform business models with the combined power of compute, context, control and secure connectivity.   We are looking for a strong Networking Presales to join the HPE Aruba sales team.   In a typical day as a Presales Technical Consultant, you would • Subject Matter Expert for HPE Aruba security products.  i.e. Network Access Control and User Entity Behavior Analytics • Gather and assess customer needs, both business and technical; • Identify related needs (lead generation, opportunity expansion) • Architect an appropriate technical solution to meet the customer's requirements • Create the appropriate test plan as required • Assess likely competitive threats • Assist with requests for expertise from peers • Maintain excellent communications with customer management • Represent company as technical expert with customers; share knowledge in area of expertise • Build customer loyalty through being a trusted advisor • Partner effectively with others in the account to ensure problem resolution and customer satisfaction • Actively supports the account team with solution advice, proposals, presentations, and other customer communications • Transfer knowledge to Presales peers via contributing participation in education programs • Contributions have strong impact with assigned territory or Regional BU, and some impact on Regional company business • Contribute to the presales direction for the Region or some areas of a BU
Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree educational background from any field. Minimum 3-5 years of network (wired and wireless) and security, with successful pre-sales support. 3+ years experiences (or equivalent) with implementing Network Security is an advantage (i.e. working in SOC/CIRT/CSIRT/CERT) Experience with investigating common types of attacks; network packet analysis; log analysis and reviewing security events In-depth knowledge of security event management, network security monitoring, log collection, and correlation Experience in SIEM usage or administration. Experience in Network Access Controller (NAC) usage or administration. Experience in User and Entity Behavior Analytics usage or administration Experience in managing/deploying some or all of the following: 	 SIEM – Security information and event management IAM – Identity and access management APT – Advanced Persistent threat detection DLP – Data loss prevention VA – Vulnerability Analysis and mitigation PKI – Public key infrastructure Secure networks Experience with managing penetration testing engagements and advising accordingly Ability to take ‘hands on’ approach and involvement in deployment where required   Security professional with proven experience in commercial, public or industrial sectors Recognized security qualifications (CISSP, CISM, CISA, ITIL) etc. Awareness of common exploits and vulnerabilities Solid network engineering and server architecture awareness Previous hands on experience in network/server and security operational roles Information Security product pre-Sales experience Previous information security management experience

Job Description: Role The Data Engineering Manager is expected to provide architectural guidance, produce design specs / documents, review adjacent systems’ design as well as lead the implementation including: writing appropriate code, deploying it and ensuring operations.  You will report directly to Workato’s Head of IT and will work closely with our engineering and product teams, our corporate IT organization, our finance team, third party companies and tools, and our DevOps and infrastructure teams, amongst others. You will be responsible for identifying the right metrics, instrumenting workflows to emit the appropriate metrics, and loading those metrics into the enterprise data warehouse.   Responsibilities We are looking for an experienced, passionate architect to build our enterprise level analytics platform that gives users easy, intuitive, and fine-grained access to Workato’s diverse and unique data assets.  The business intelligence architect will design and implement the company’s enterprise level system to gather and provide appropriate metrics and data for key stakeholders across the organization - including executive leadership - to be able to analyze and report on performance and metrics from our key 1st and 3rd party systems.
Job Requirements: Requirements   Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology or another computer-based discipline. Master degree preferred   Minimum 8 years hands-on experience, and 2 years of manager level experience (including people management) in developing BI solutions (Data Integration, Modeling, Analytics or Reporting)     Minimum 8 years of SQL experience and a record of accomplishment of designing, deploying and evolving ETL solutions to meet business requirements.   Deep experience in architecting cloud based data-warehouse solutions (e.g. AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery,Snowflake etc.), powering BI visualization platforms (e.g. Tableau, Looker, etc.) and exposure to transactional systems (e.g. Salesforce, Marketo, Workday, etc.)   Strong experience leading a business intelligence platform, developing long-term roadmaps and strategic direction, and evangelizing the value of data driven decision making   Fanatic about leveraging best practices for master data management, enterprise level data models, and data marts   Proven analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills and ability to communicate well, even to non-technical users   Bonus Points   Preference for experience at a fast growing SaaS business with experience with metrics like churn, profitability metrics, and people-based marketing analytics     Strong desire to teach and mentor others, especially educating cross-functional peers     Extensive knowledge of Data Warehousing principles and dimensional models; sourcing data from OLTP, SaaS, and OLAP application   Application instructions: To apply, please fill up the application form at https://jobs.workato.com/apply/?gh_jid=4193852002

Job Description: The Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.
Job Requirements: ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.
